0.title: K'taka CM inaugurates Sanjeevini SARAS fair in B'luru; buys sarees
0.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Friday inaugurated the Sanjeevini SARAS fair at the campus of Bengaluru's National College Basavanagudi. Bommai also purchased sarees from the various self-help groups at the fair, which was organised by Karnataka's entrepreneurship and livelihood department. About 300 stalls that were set up at the fair, displayed the work of women from across the country.

1.title: Pune to see day temperatures around 40°C till Apr 14, rain unlikely in coming days: IMD
1.article_body: The day temperatures in Pune will continue to hover around 40 degrees Celsius till April 14, according to the IMD. "There's no chance of rain in Pune in the coming few days. There will be partly cloudy conditions for the next 48 hours, after which the sky will be clear," head of the weather forecasting department at IMD Pune said.

2.title: Pune police file FIR as 13 cheated of ₹2.53 cr in admissions scam
2.article_body: Pune's Yerwada police station has filed an FIR after about 13 people were cheated of ₹2.53 crore by a group of men under the pretext of getting admission at a medical college in Nashik. This comes after one of the 13 people filed a complaint claiming that the accused took ₹30.72 lakh and promised his child's admission to the college.

3.title: 2 held at Amritsar airport for smuggling 10 kg gold from Sharjah
3.article_body: Two persons were arrested by the Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) at Amritsar airport on Tuesday for smuggling gold from Sharjah (UAE). They recovered 10 kg of gold worth around ₹1.9 crore from them that was hidden in their clothes and headgear to evade customs duty. The accused are residents of Jalandhar and had visited UAE on a tourist visa.

4.title: Over 10 shanties gutted as fire breaks out at slum cluster in Gurugram
4.article_body: Over 10 shanties were gutted after a fire broke out at a slum cluster in Gurugram's Sector 74 on the Southern Peripheral Road on Friday evening, officials said. No casualties were reported, officials added. The fire had spread across an area of over 1.5 acres due to plastic and polythene material that had been collected at the cluster, officials stated.

5.title: 4-foot-long spectacled cobra rescued from Andheri
5.article_body: A four-foot-long spectacled cobra was rescued by Resqink Association for Wildlife Welfare (RAWW) from Mumbai's Andheri around midnight on Thursday. The venomous cobra was spotted behind a water tank in a house inhabited by nearly 10 labourers. According to RAWW member Sahil Vichare, the house is a part of slum area, thus making it easy for the cobra to enter.

6.title: Will Smith banned from attending Oscars for 10 years
6.article_body: Actor Will Smith has been banned from attending Oscars and other Academy events for 10 years after he slapped Chris Rock at Oscars 2022 ceremony. In a statement, the Academy said the 94th Oscars had been "overshadowed by the unacceptable and harmful behaviour" exhibited by Smith. It added that banning Smith was aimed at protecting performers and guests.

7.title: Delhi sees hottest day of year so far with maximum temperature at 41.6°C
7.article_body: Amid a 'severe heatwave', Delhi on Friday recorded a maximum temperature of 41.6°C, the highest so far this year, according to the India Meteorological Department (IMD). The maximum temperature at most places in Delhi on Friday settled at least seven degrees above normal. IMD has issued an orange alert, warning of a 'severe heatwave' in Delhi on Saturday too.

8.title: He knows he won't win so decided to campaign for India? Pak PM Imran's ex-wife
8.article_body: After Pakistan PM Imran Khan praised India ahead of a trust vote, his ex-wife Reham Khan said, "He knows he can't win again so decided to campaign for India? Khudaar qaum suddenly!!" Imran had said, "Indians are khuddar quam (very self-respecting people). No superpower can dictate terms to India." "Pakistan gets used as...tissue paper and thrown away," he added.

9.title: Bengaluru bans sale of meat on Rama Navami, official says routine order
9.article_body: The Bengaluru civic body issued an order prohibiting animal slaughter and sale of meat on Rama Navami on April 10. Every year there is a blanket ban on sale of meat and animal slaughter on Rama Navami and such bans are imposed on at least eight days a year on events like Gandhi Jayanti, Sarvodaya Day, a BBMP official said.

10.title: 2 arrested with heroin worth ₹5.7 crore hidden in water bottles in Mumbai
10.article_body: Mumbai Police has arrested two persons and seized heroin worth ₹5.7 crore concealed in water bottles, which had specially-made sections in bottom halves to smuggle the contraband. Police also checked the bag the accused were carrying and found more heroin in it. Police had been on the lookout for one of the accused, a woman, for the past seven months.

11.title: Tewatia smashes 2 sixes on last 2 balls as GT defeat PBKS to win 3rd match in a row
11.article_body: With 12 runs needed to win on the last two deliveries, Gujarat Titans (GT) all-rounder Rahul Tewatia smashed two sixes to help his team chase down the 190-run target against PBKS. GT have now won three matches in a row and are currently the only unbeaten side in IPL 2022. Opener Shubman Gill top-scored for Gujarat Titans with 96(59).

12.title: Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt to get married on April 14, confirms her uncle
12.article_body: Robin Bhatt has confirmed that Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt are set to tie the knot on April 14, according to India Today. Robin is Mahesh Bhatt's half-brother and a writer in Bollywood. Alia's mehendi ceremony will take place on April 13, India Today further said. The couple will reportedly get married in an intimate ceremony.

13.title: I accept SC verdict with heavy heart but disappointed: Pak PM ahead of no-trust vote
13.article_body: Pakistan PM Imran Khan on Friday said he is very upset with the Supreme Court's ruling in favour of the no-trust vote against him. Khan, who's set to face a no-confidence vote tomorrow, said, "I accept...court's verdict with heavy heart, but I'm...disappointed." The court had termed National Assembly Deputy Speaker's decision to dismiss the no-confidence motion against Khan as "unconstitutional".

14.title: US envoy said Imran Khan should not have visited Moscow: Pak PM
14.article_body: Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan on Friday said in an address to the nation that the US ambassador told his Pakistani counterparts that Imran Khan should not have visited Moscow to meet with Russian President Vladimir Putin. The US also said Pakistan would suffer if he survived the no-confidence vote called against him by the opposition, Khan added.

15.title: No superpower can dictate terms to India: Pakistan PM Imran Khan
15.article_body: Pakistan PM Imran Khan, while addressing the nation on the eve of no-trust vote, highlighted India's foreign policy. Khan said he is "in awe of the functioning of the neighbouring country which does not allow any foreign power to make decisions for it". He added that no superpower can dictate terms to India.

16.title: Imran Khan cries while praising India, says 'I got lots of love there'
16.article_body: Imran Khan broke down while praising India during the live address to Pakistani citizens ahead of no-confidence vote against him. "Now we have to decide what kind of Pakistan do we want...I know India better than others. I had friendships in India because of cricket. I got lots of love and respect there," he said as he got emotional.

17.title: I feel he's holding back: Shastri on new CSK captain Ravindra Jadeja
17.article_body: Commenting on defending champions CSK's new skipper Ravindra Jadeja, who replaced MS Dhoni ahead of IPL 2022, Ravi Shastri said Jadeja needs to be involved and announce himself more. "I feel he's holding back. I want him to be more in the face...have more communication with his boys...be more involved in...proceedings," he explained. CSK have been winless so far.

18.title: Alternatives to Russian weapons are too expensive, India told US: Bloomberg report
18.article_body: India has conveyed to the US that the alternatives to Russian weapons are too expensive, Bloomberg reported citing people aware of India-US exchanges on the Russian invasion of Ukraine. As per the report, US Assistant Secretary of State Victoria Nuland had offered help to India in finding alternative sources of weapons to counter neighbours Pakistan and China.

19.title: 3 businessmen pay $55 million each for 10-day trip to Space Station
19.article_body: SpaceX on Friday launched three businessmen and a retired NASA astronaut to the International Space Station (ISS). The businessmen are paying $55 million each to Axiom Space for their 10-day trip. The crew will spend eight days on the US portion of the ISS and conduct 25 science experiments. The launch marks the first fully private mission to the ISS.

20.title: Friends gift bottles of petrol & diesel to newly-wed couple in TN
20.article_body: A newly-wed couple, Grace Kumar and his bride Keerthana, was gifted bottles of petrol and diesel by their friends recently, pictures of which have surfaced on social media. The incident took place in the Chengalpattu district of Tamil Nadu. Petrol and diesel are priced over ₹110 and over ₹100 per litre in the state respectively.

21.title: Video of pet dog beaten to death by healthcare worker in China sparks criticism
21.article_body: Authorities in China are facing criticism after a video showed a corgi being beaten to death by a healthcare worker in locked-down city of Shanghai. The dog's owners tested COVID-19 positive and were taken to a quarantine centre. The corgi chased the van for a short distance as it left, after which the worker hit the dog with a spade.

22.title: RCB's Karthik, KKR's Umesh look most settled in their new team: Bhogle
22.article_body: On being asked about players who looked most settled in their new team in IPL 2022, commentator Harsha Bhogle picked RCB wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik and KKR pacer Umesh Yadav. "Karthik goes back to RCB and he's finishing like he has not gone anywhere," he added. With nine wickets from four matches, Umesh is currently the leading wicket-taker in the tournament.

23.title: Jurgen Klopp is biggest rival I've ever had: Man City's Pep Guardiola
23.article_body: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola said Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp is "the biggest rival I've ever had in my career". Guardiola previously faced off against Real Madrid's Jose Mourinho when he was the manager of Barcelona. "In the last five years they have been the biggest opponent," Guardiola said. Manchester City will face Liverpool in the Premier League on Sunday.

24.title: We can't afford to drop points anymore: Man Utd's Rangnick on PL season
24.article_body: Manchester United interim boss Ralf Rangnick on Friday said his team cannot afford to drop any more points this season if they wish to finish in the top four of the Premier League. Manchester United face 17th placed Everton in the Premier League on Saturday. "We're all aware of the importance of the game for both sides," Rangnick said.

25.title: €240 million allocated by UEFA for clubs in 2020-24 benefits programme
25.article_body: UEFA on Friday said it has allocated €240 million to pay clubs for releasing their players for national team competitions as part of its benefits programme for the 2020-2024 cycle. The amount is based on the total generated by the European Championship tournament. UEFA said €200 million was paid to 697 clubs across all 55 member associations after EURO 2020.

26.title: 53-year-old woman's skin cells 'de-aged' by 30 years in trial by UK researchers
26.article_body: In a new trial conducted by researchers in UK's Cambridge, the skin cells of a 53-year-old woman were successfully 'de-aged' by 30 years. The partially rejuvenated cells showed signs of behaving more like youthful cells in wound simulations, the Babraham Institute said. The technology used is built on the techniques employed to create Dolly the cloned sheep in 1996.

27.title: EU adopts 5th package of sanctions against Russia; bans coal imports
27.article_body: The European Union (EU) on Friday adopted its fifth package of sanctions against Russia following its invasion of Ukraine that includes a ban on the import of Russian coal. The ban on coal imports will be fully effective from the second week of August. The new sanctions also prevent Russian trucks and vessels from accessing the EU.

28.title: We have significant losses of troops: Russia on Ukraine invasion
28.article_body: Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov on Thursday admitted Russia has suffered "significant losses of troops" following its invasion of Ukraine which began on February 24. "It's a huge tragedy for us," Peskov added. Ukrainian authorities have claimed at least 18,900 Russian troops have been killed in combat so far. The UN said over four million people have fled Ukraine so far.

29.title: Want to make good impression again: Bairstow on joining new IPL team PBKS
29.article_body: Speaking about joining PBKS in IPL 2022, batter Jonny Bairstow said he's enjoying it as it's a new franchise with a new group of players. "Obviously, it's an exciting time. You want to make...good impression again," he added. He further said that brand of cricket PBKS are playing is great. PBKS is Bairstow's second franchise in IPL after SRH.

30.title: Heroin worth ₹18 crore hidden in soap cases seized from car in Assam
30.article_body: Assam Police on Thursday seized 2.275 kilograms of heroin worth ₹18 crore from a car in Karimganj. According to the police, the drugs were kept hidden in 175 soap cases inside the four secret chambers of the car, which was coming from Aizawl. Further, police arrested four persons involved in the case and also seized the car.

31.title: 2 killed after fire breaks out in COVID-19 hospital in Greece
31.article_body: Authorities said two people have died due to a fire that broke out on Wednesday in a COVID-19 hospital in Greece. Firefighters discovered the body of a 79-year-old COVID-19 patient on Wednesday while a 52-year-old man died of his injuries on Thursday. Another patient is being treated for burns in the hospital. Over 30 patients were evacuated from the ward.

32.title: PBKS' Liam Livingstone smashes second-fastest fifty of IPL 2022
32.article_body: PBKS' Liam Livingstone on Friday smashed the second-fastest fifty of IPL 2022 by reaching the 50-run mark off 21 deliveries against GT. The 28-year-old scored 64 runs off 27 deliveries, including seven fours and four sixes. KKR's Pat Cummins smashed the fastest fifty of IPL 2022 and joint-fastest fifty in IPL history off 14 deliveries against MI on April 6.

33.title: Akshata Murthy, wife of UK minister Rishi Sunak is richer than the Queen: Report
33.article_body: Akshata Murthy, the wife of British Finance Minister Rishi Sunak and daughter of Infosys co-founder Narayana Murthy, is reportedly richer than the Queen, whose personal wealth is about £350 million. With an estimated fortune of £690 million (over ₹6,834 crore), 42-year-old Akshata owns a 0.9% stake in Infosys, worth £430 million. She also receives about £11.5 million in annual dividends.

34.title: German Parliament rejects vaccine mandate for people aged over 60
34.article_body: The German Parliament on Thursday rejected a proposal for a COVID-19 vaccine mandate for people aged over 60. The Bill was supported by Chancellor Olaf Scholz and Health Minister Karl Lauterbach. Out of 674 MPs, 378 voted against a vaccine mandate while 296 voted for it. A recent opinion poll showed that about 60% of Germans support a vaccine mandate.

35.title: US to supply Ukraine with new weapon systems
35.article_body: Secretary of State Antony Blinken said the US will send new weapon systems to Ukraine after NATO foreign ministers decided to increase arms deliveries to Ukraine following the atrocities in Bucha by Russian forces. "We're not going to let anything stand in the way of getting Ukrainians what they need, and what we believe, to be effective," Blinken said.

36.title: Many felt I'm showing feminine traits: Nawazuddin on playing Laila
36.article_body: Actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui, speaking about his role Laila in 'Heropanti 2', said that he incorporated the character's traits in his real life including Laila's walk and feminine touch. "Many...told me that my walk is different from my usual style. Many thought I am displaying feminine qualities," he added. Nawazuddin further said he dropped the mannerisms after the shoot was completed.

37.title: I'm trying not to put myself in any box as an actor: Ananya Panday
37.article_body: Actress Ananya Panday has stated that she is trying not to put herself in any sort of box as an actor. Ananya added that she wants to try a little bit of everything and evolve with every film and character that she does. "'Liger' is very different from a 'Gehraiyaan' or even a 'Kho Gaye Hum Kahan'," the actress said.

38.title: Taiwan Prez tests COVID-19 -ve after relative she met tests positive
38.article_body: Taiwan President Tsai Ing-wen's office on Friday said she tested negative for COVID-19 after a relative she shared a meal with at her residence tested positive. Presidential Office Spokesperson Xavier Chang said Tsai is in good health but will continue to work from home until April 14. Chang added all her public events will be cancelled during the same period.

39.title: Red Bull are a 'tiny bit' off Ferrari: Verstappen ahead of Aus GP
39.article_body: Formula One world champion Max Verstappen on Friday said Red Bull are a "tiny bit" off Ferrari after both practice sessions ahead of the Australian Grand Prix. Verstappen finished second fastest behind Ferrari's Charles Leclerc during the second practice session. "We definitely made some good improvements today," Verstappen said. The Dutch driver won the previous Grand Prix in Saudi Arabia.

40.title: 21-year-old Indian student shot dead outside subway station in Canada
40.article_body: A 21-year-old student, Kartik Vasudev, from Ghaziabad in Uttar Pradesh was shot dead in Canada's Toronto while he was on his way to his part-time job on Thursday, police said. He was reportedly killed in a robbery attempt. "We are shocked & distressed at the unfortunate killing...We are in touch with the family," the Consulate General of India tweeted.

41.title: They're amazing together, hope everything goes well: Neetu on Alia-Ranbir
41.article_body: Veteran actress Neetu Kapoor, on being asked about her son actor Ranbir Kapoor's wedding with actress Alia Bhatt, stated that they are amazing together. "I just love both of them and they are amazing human beings. They complement each other really well...I am really hoping everything goes well," she added. Alia and Ranbir are rumoured to get married in April.

42.title: It was a difficult session: Mercedes' Hamilton ahead of Aus Grand Prix
42.article_body: Lewis Hamilton said the second practice session of the Australian Grand Prix was "a difficult session" as Hamilton and teammate George Russell finished outside the top 10. Hamilton was 13th fastest while Russell finished 11th fastest in the session. "It's just nothing you change on the car makes a difference at the moment, so that's the difficult thing," he said.

43.title: Life in the Himalayas: ITBP as it shares pics taken by jawans
43.article_body: The Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) took to its Instagram page recently to share pictures taken by the jawans. "Life in the #Himalayas. Pictures by #Himveers," the caption of the post read. "The wonders of Himalayas," a person commented on the post while praising the pictures. "Superb clicks," another comment read.

44.title: He gives players freedom to express themselves: Gill on GT captain Hardik
44.article_body: Gujarat Titans opener Shubman Gill has praised captain Hardik Pandya for giving players the "freedom and confidence" to play the way as they would want to in the ongoing IPL. He added that this quality makes Hardik "special" as a captain. GT are currently the only unbeaten team in IPL 2022 after two matches. They are fourth in the standings.

45.title: Barcelona draw 1-1 with Eintracht Frankfurt in Europa League quarter-final
45.article_body: Barcelona on Thursday were held to a 1-1 draw with Eintracht Frankfurt in the first-leg of their UEFA Europa League quarter-final. Ansgar Knauff scored in the 48th minute to give Frankfurt the lead before Ferran Torres equalised for Barcelona in the 66th minute. Elsewhere, RB Leipzig drew 1-1 with Atalanta while West Ham United drew 1-1 with Lyon.

46.title: It's been a lifestyle change for me: Ranbir on transformation for 'Animal'
46.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor, speaking about his physical transformation for upcoming film 'Animal', has said that it has been a lifestyle change for him. "I think that will be very challenging for me after 'Sanju'," the actor added. He further said that he wants to do it correctly with diet and the correct amount of workout, rest and recovery.

47.title: We're in a position to start testing, running pilot digital rupee projects: RBI
47.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) is in a position to start off with testing and running pilot projects of central bank digital currency (CBDC) or digital rupee, Deputy Governor T Rabi Sankar said. He added that the RBI will take a calibrated and nuanced approach towards CBDC and ensure that it is introduced in a manner that is non-disruptive.

48.title: Posing as govt officials, gang steals 60-foot iron bridge built 50 yrs ago in Bihar
48.article_body: A gang of thieves posing as officers of the State Irrigation Department allegedly stole a 60-feet defunct iron bridge in Bihar. The accused used gas cutters and earthmover machines to demolish the bridge, which was built in 1972. They also took the help of locals during the removal of the bridge. A police case has been filed in the matter.

49.title: 3 jailed for life for raping 2 girls, passing it as suicide in Assam
49.article_body: A fast-track court in Assam's Kokrajhar district sentenced three men to life imprisonment for raping two minor tribal girls in June 2021. The rapists had tried to stage it as suicide and hence hung the bodies of the girls from a tree. The SIT had solved the case within 48 hours. Police had arrested a total of seven people.

50.title: It seems there's Taliban rule in Rajasthan: Poonia on Karauli violence
50.article_body: Rajasthan BJP president Satish Poonia on Friday said, "The way CM Ashok Gehlot is doing the politics of appeasement in Rajasthan, it seems that there is Taliban rule in the state." He claimed the human rights of people are being violated in Rajasthan. The BJP leader further demanded a judicial investigation into clashes that broke out in Karauli last week.

51.title: SpaceX launches first all-private astronaut crew to the Space Station
51.article_body: SpaceX on Friday launched four civilian astronauts to the International Space Station (ISS), marking the first time a completely private crew has visited the ISS. The crew, led by former NASA astronaut Michael López-Alegría, includes Canadian investor Mark Pathy, American investor Larry Connor, and former Israeli Air Force pilot Eytan Stibbe. The crew will spend eight days on the ISS.

52.title: His retirement was a shocker: Maxwell on RCB teammate De Villiers
52.article_body: Recalling his RCB teammate AB de Villiers' retirement from all forms of cricket in November 2021, batter Glenn Maxwell said the announcement came as a "little bit of a shocker". He added, "I thought he was probably going to go one more year...he's still a superstar...has played the roles for us and he was still leading by [an] example."

53.title: There's a new trend of govts maligning judges, it is unfortunate: CJI
53.article_body: Chief Justice of India NV Ramana has said that there's a "new trend" of governments "maligning" judges if judgments aren't to their liking, adding, "It's unfortunate." He said this while hearing an appeal by the Chhattisgarh government challenging HC's decision to quash an FIR against an ex-IAS officer. "Whatever fight you may take...don't try to malign the courts," said Ramana.

54.title: 1st time I messaged a girl on a dating app, I called her sis: Lilly on being bisexual
54.article_body: YouTuber-comedian Lilly Singh, speaking to Vogue India about her dating life after revealing she's bisexual, said, "A big part of it was learning how to flirt with girls." "The first time I messaged a girl on a dating app, I called her sis. I literally had to stop...myself," she added. Lilly further said she is "getting better at it".

55.title: Customer sues Burger King in US, claims Whoppers smaller than advertised
55.article_body: A customer in the US has filed a lawsuit against Burger King, accusing them of misleading customers with the size of their Whoppers. The lawsuit claimed the burger is 35% smaller than advertised. It also argued that Burger King began inflating the size of its burgers in photos around September 2017, while before it, products were advertised "more fairly".

56.title: We're not aware of it: NPCI as Coinbase says users can buy crypto with UPI
56.article_body: The National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) has clarified it's not aware of any crypto exchange using UPI after US-based Coinbase said it will allow users to buy cryptocurrencies with UPI. Coinbase later said that it was aware of the recent statement published by NPCI. "We are committed to working with NPCI and other relevant authorities," the crypto exchange said.

57.title: He came from nothing and built a world-class firm: UK FM on Narayana Murthy
57.article_body: UK's Finance Minister Rishi Sunak praised his father-in-law and Infosys Founder NR Narayana Murthy and said, "He came from nothing and has created a world-class business." He added, "If I achieved a tenth of what my father-in-law achieved in his life, I'd be a happy person." Sunak's statements come amid controversy over his India-born wife Akshata Murthy's non-domicile tax status.

58.title: Bombay HC grants bail to man accused of killing wife's lover
58.article_body: The Bombay HC on Wednesday granted bail to a man, who was booked in Pune for allegedly killing the lover of his wife. HC said the witnesses haven't supported their claims. It was claimed that the deceased and the accused's wife continued their affair despite getting married. Thus, according to the prosecution, the applicant had assaulted him on being annoyed.

59.title: 19-yr-old girl poisoned by college classmates for refusing to have sex in Raj; dies
59.article_body: A 19-year-old college girl died during treatment in Rajasthan's Bharatpur after five of her male classmates allegedly poisoned her for refusing to have sex with them, police said. The students allegedly followed her when she was returning home on Wednesday and forcefully made her drink some liquid, following which she started vomiting, the police added.

60.title: Centre writes to 4 states and 1 UT over rise in COVID-19 cases
60.article_body: Union Health Secretary Rajesh Bhushan has written to the governments of Delhi, Haryana, Kerala, Maharashtra and Mizoram over the increase in COVID-19 cases there over the past week. The states have been asked to strictly monitor the cases and take pre-emptive action if necessary, ANI reported. India reported 1,109 new COVID-19 cases on Friday.

61.title: Important to reveal name: Sehwag as Chahal claims a drunk cricketer hung him from balcony
61.article_body: After Yuzvendra Chahal claimed that a cricketer hung him from a 15th-floor balcony in a Bengaluru hotel after getting drunk in 2013, Virender Sehwag said it is important to reveal the name of the player. "If true, this cannot be treated as fun, important to know what happened and what action was taken considering the seriousness of this," Sehwag added.

62.title: Publication didn't print my spiritual journey due to bikini pics: Sofia
62.article_body: Television personality and self-styled godwoman Sofia Hayat has revealed that a major publication interviewed her about her spiritual journey but decided not to run it due to her bikini pictures on Instagram. "Because how can a former nun be spiritual and have the gifts...I would rather go naked because that's my pure natural sacred state," Sofia wrote on Instagram.

63.title: I've played myself in films, don't want to do that anymore: Usha Uthup
63.article_body: Veteran singer-actress Usha Uthup has stated that she has played herself in films, adding that she doesn't want to do that anymore. "I don't mind playing a small character as long as it adds meaning to the story," she added. Usha further said that she has worked with actors like Mammootty, Kamal Haasan, Naseeruddin Shah, Amitabh Bachchan and Annu Kapoor.

64.title: It's a dream come true: Rajapaksa on representing PBKS in his maiden IPL
64.article_body: Sharing his maiden IPL experience, PBKS batter Bhanuka Rajapaksa said, "It's been a dream come true." He added, "My wife...broke the news to me that I had been bought by PBKS...it's sort of a miracle that I got into...same side that I've been supporting since I was a kid." Rajapaksa has scored total 83 runs in IPL 2022 so far.

65.title: Raj govt orders probe into Karauli incident, wants report in 15 days
65.article_body: The Rajasthan government on Friday ordered an administrative probe into clashes that broke out in Karauli last week, ANI reported. The report would have to be submitted within 15 days. Notably, communal clashes broke out in Karauli on Saturday, injuring over 25 persons. Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot had earlier assured of strict action against those responsible for the Karauli incident.

66.title: Man walks on rope tied between 2 hot air balloons at 6,236 ft to create Guinness record
66.article_body: Guinness World Records recently shared a video of the world record attempt for the 'highest slackline walk' and it has gone viral. The video shows a man named Rafael Zugno Bridi from Brazil walking barefoot on a rope tied between two hot air balloons flying midair. He successfully created the record at 1,901 metres (6,236 ft).

67.title: Gang steals 1,600 kg of cheese worth ₹17 lakh from dairy farm in Netherlands
67.article_body: A gang of thieves allegedly stole 1,600 kilos of cheese worth $23,000 (around ₹17 lakh) from a dairy farm in the Netherlands. A farmer at the dairy said that almost all the cheese from their storage was taken. As per an official, the stolen cheese is transported to countries like Russia where Dutch cheese cannot be bought due to sanctions.

68.title: Earliest-known galaxy spotted 13.5 bn light-years away, pic released
68.article_body: Astronomers have discovered what appears to be the earliest, most distant galaxy ever spotted- a galaxy named HD1. It is estimated to be 13.5 billion light-years away from Earth and is said to have existed 330 million years after the Big Bang. "HD1 would represent a giant baby in the delivery room of the early universe," said an astronomer.

69.title: GT to bowl first against PBKS in their IPL 2022 clash, playing XIs announced
69.article_body: Gujarat Titans (GT) captain Hardik Pandya won the toss and elected to bowl first against Punjab Kings (PBKS) in their IPL 2022 clash. GT have made two changes to their playing XI, with Sai Sudharsan and Darshan Nalkande replacing Vijay Shankar and Varun Aaron. Meanwhile, Jonny Bairstow has replaced Bhanuka Rajapaksa in PBKS' playing XI.

70.title: Mahesh Babu Foundation sponsors heart surgeries of 30 children
70.article_body: Telugu actor Mahesh Babu's non-profit organisation Mahesh Babu Foundation sponsored the heart surgeries and interventions of 30 children with the help of Andhra Hospitals on the occasion of World Health Day. His wife actress Namrata Shirodkar took to Instagram to share pictures of a few of the children and announced Andhra Pradesh Governor Sri Biswa Bhusan Harichandan felicitated the event.

71.title: RBI imposes monetary penalty of ₹93 lakh on Axis Bank, ₹90 lakh on IDBI Bank
71.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) imposed a monetary penalty of ₹93 lakh on Axis Bank and ₹90 lakh on IDBI Bank. RBI fined Axis Bank for non-compliance with directions on loans and advances, KYC guidelines and penalties on non-maintenance of minimum balance in savings accounts. IDBI Bank was fined for reporting frauds to RBI with delay, among other things.

72.title: She found out husband is gay on honeymoon, read his chats: Lawyer of Maha woman
72.article_body: The lawyer of the 29-year-old woman who filed a complaint against her husband for cheating her by hiding that he's gay has said she came to know about his sexual orientation during their honeymoon. "While checking his mobile phone...she found his unusual WhatsApp chat with some people," he added. A court in Maharashtra's Thane rejected the man's anticipatory bail plea.

73.title: Couple steals jewellery & cash worth ₹5 lakh from friend's house in Thane
73.article_body: A couple has been arrested for allegedly stealing jewellery and cash worth ₹5 lakh from the house of a friend in Thane. The accused woman convinced her friend to allow her to stay in her house. "Two days ahead of the incident, she also called her husband, and one more man who allegedly is her boyfriend," police said.

74.title: Interview of Chahal claiming drunk Symonds, Franklin tied him, taped his mouth resurfaces
74.article_body: An interview of Yuzvendra Chahal claiming his then MI teammates Andrew Symonds and James Franklin tied him in a Chennai hotel and taped his mouth after getting drunk in 2011 has resurfaced. Chahal said he was freed after a cleaner saw him the next morning. The interview resurfaced after Chahal claimed a cricketer hung him from 15th-floor balcony in 2013.

75.title: 26/11 mastermind Hafiz Saeed sentenced to 31 years in jail by Pak court
75.article_body: An anti-terrorism court in Pakistan has sentenced Lashkar-e-Taiba co-founder Hafiz Saeed to 31 years in prison and also ordered the confiscation of all his assets. The terrorist, who masterminded the 26/11 Mumbai terror attacks, has also been reportedly fined PKR 3,40,000. The action has reportedly been taken in two cases of terror financing.

76.title: It was tough raising kids alone; Mira brought us together: Neliima
76.article_body: Actors Shahid Kapoor and Ishaan Khatter's mother Neliima Azeem has stated that she raised her children as a single mother and it was very tough in those days. "[Shahid's wife Mira Rajput] has brought our entire family together," she added. Neliima further said that she is happy to watch her sons do exceptionally good work after struggling for many years.

77.title: Mosquito density up by 50% in South Delhi in a year: SDMC survey
77.article_body: A six-day survey conducted by the health department of the South Delhi Municipal Corporation (SDMC) has revealed that the mosquito density has increased by 50% from last year in the areas of south Delhi. The survey, which was conducted between March 28 and April 2, reveals that most of the mosquitoes detected do not spread dengue, malaria or chikungunya.

78.title: Hatred is being spread & country is being divided: Rahul Gandhi
78.article_body: After meeting Rashtriya Janata Dal leader Sharad Yadav, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said that hatred is being spread and the country is being divided. Rahul said, "I agree with what he (Sharad Yadav) said today that the country is in a very bad situation." "India was one nation earlier, [BJP] has created different nations within the nation now," he added.

79.title: Rare 'one-in 200-million' identical triplet boys from UK to turn 1, pics go viral
79.article_body: The parents of "one-in-200 million" identical triplet boys, Jimmy, Jenson and Jaxson, from Cheshire are preparing for their sons' first birthday. Gina Dewdney and her husband Craig were told by doctors that their naturally-conceived babies were a rare occurrence. "Being a mum is the best job I've ever had. It's the hardest job by far but I...love it," said Gina.

80.title: MSRTC employees protest outside Pawar's Mumbai house, throw shoes
80.article_body: Over 100 workers of Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation (MSRTC), who are seeking the corporation's merger with government, protested outside NCP chief Sharad Pawar's residence in Mumbai on Friday. Some hurled shoes at his house. The workers blamed Pawar for not resolving their issues. "Some 120 MSRTC employees have died by suicide...These are not suicides, but murders," an employee said.

81.title: Elon Musk wears cowboy hat, drives oldest Tesla model at company event
81.article_body: The world's richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk wore a cowboy hat, and sunglasses as he drove the oldest model Tesla ever built, at Tesla's Cyber Rodeo event on Thursday. The event marked the opening of the company's Giga Texas factory near Austin. Videos from the event showed the factory plant looking like a nightclub.

82.title: Video is distorted: Hindu mahant who threatened to rape Muslim women
82.article_body: Hindu mahant Bajrang Muni Das, who was seen in a video threatening Muslim women with rape in UP's Sitapur, claimed the video was distorted to implicate him. "If they'll harass our daughters, their daughters won't be safe too," he added. "During our Kalash Yatra, (Muslims) were prepared with sticks and stones to repeat Karauli-like incident," he alleged.

83.title: Mayank's batting has been affected since becoming PBKS' skipper: Sehwag
83.article_body: Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag said he's concerned about Mayank Agarwal's batting in IPL 2022, adding that his batting has been affected after becoming PBKS' skipper. "He was consistent last year with the bat. He should focus on his batting and forget about his captaincy when he walks out to bat," he added. Mayank has scored 32, 1, 4 so far.

84.title: 52-yr-old man falls while alighting from moving train in Kalyan, dies
84.article_body: A 52-year-old man died after he lost his balance while alighting from a moving train fell into the gap between the platform and the footboard at Kalyan railway station. The deceased identified as Pradip Bhangale was travelling from Bhusawal to Kalyan on Thursday when the incident took place. The incident was caught on the CCTV cameras installed at the station.

85.title: Video shows ACP slapping UP man 5 times, pulling hair for eve-teasing, harassing girl
85.article_body: A video showing ACP Tirpurari Pandey slapping a man accused of eve-teasing and harassing a girl student in Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur. Pandey can be seen slapping the man five times before pulling his hair on a busy road. He also warned the man of dire consequences if he continued to indulge in such crimes.

86.title: I am getting a lot of FOMO for not being there: Sam Curran on IPL 2022
86.article_body: England all-rounder Sam Curran, who withdrew from IPL mega auction as he's currently recovering from a back injury, said, "I'm getting a lot of FOMO for not being there and I want to tap my CSK mates." He added, "I hope CSK make it to the playoffs, but it's been a tough start...They need to turn it around pretty quickly."

87.title: Pregnant women face many judgements, but my baby is a miracle: Debina
87.article_body: Television actress Debina Bonnerjee, who welcomed her baby girl on April 3 with husband actor Gurmeet Choudhary, has called her child a miracle. "It was tough, emotionally, physically but everything is worth it when I see her face," she added. Debina further said that pregnant women face many judgements about what to wear, what to eat and how to exercise.

88.title: Heartening to see him grow: Ashneer shares update on Shark Tank contestant
88.article_body: Shark Tank India judge Ashneer Grover took to Instagram to share a picture with Beyond Snack's Founder Manas. Speaking about Manas' business, Grover wrote, "Kerala Banana Chips was the first deal of Shark Tank Season 1 and it's heartening to see him grow 3x in scale profitably within 6 months!" Grover had invested in Beyond Snack.

89.title: Wasim Jaffer shares Hera Pheri's taxi scene to describe PBKS' selection problem
89.article_body: Wasim Jaffer shared the taxi scene from 'Hera Pheri' to describe PBKS' selection problem ahead of their clash against GT. "PBKS trying to fit Bairstow, Rabada, Livingstone, Rajapaksa and Odean Smith into the XI," he tweeted. In the scene, Om Puri's character Kharak Singh and his fellow villagers can be seen spilling out of the taxi while trying to fit.

90.title: Shahrukh could be X-factor for PBKS: Sehwag ahead of PBKS vs GT
90.article_body: Ahead of PBKS-GT in IPL 2022, Virender Sehwag said batter Shahrukh Khan could be the "X-factor" for PBKS if he bats "explosively" down the order. Meanwhile, Ajay Jadeja said pacer Kagiso Rabada is an important player. "If there's any weakness in Gujarat, it's their top-order that hasn't been exposed yet and that's why Rabada is key for Punjab," he added.

91.title: Covishield booster dose to be sold at discounted price of ₹600 plus tax: Poonawalla
91.article_body: Serum Institute of India will sell the precaution or booster dose of COVID-19 vaccine Covishield to private hospitals and vaccination centres at a "discounted price" of ₹600, SII CEO Adar Poonawalla said. This came after the government said all adults can take the booster dose from April 10. Covishield's price has been capped at ₹780 (including taxes) at private hospitals.

92.title: Locals can tell relatives they're alive: Ukraine Vice PM thanks Musk for Starlink
92.article_body: Ukraine's Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov has thanked SpaceX CEO Elon Musk for Starlink satellite internet. He said that operation of electricity and mobile communications haven't been restored in the village of Ivankiv, but "Starlink came on time". Fedorov wrote, "Locals finally are able to tell relatives that they are alive. Thanks Elon Musk, your help is priceless for Ukraine."

93.title: CBI refuses to provide update through RTI in Sushant Singh Rajput case
93.article_body: The CBI has refused to provide update in reply to an RTI query seeking information in the Sushant Singh Rajput case. The late actor was found dead at his home in Mumbai's Bandra on June 14, 2020. The CBI has stated that the case is in the process of investigation and information about the progress may impede the investigation process.

94.title: B'luru Police arrest 7 of interstate gang for trafficking women abroad
94.article_body: The Central Crime Branch of Bengaluru Police's Women Protection Wing has arrested seven members of an interstate gang for trafficking women abroad. Preliminary investigation suggested that women from economically weaker sections of society were trafficked abroad after the gang members lured them into lucrative jobs abroad, police said. The victims were from Karnataka, Maharashtra and other states.

95.title: India need a finisher after Dhoni: Shastri on Karthik playing T20 WC 2022
95.article_body: Discussing Dinesh Karthik's potential selection in Team India's squad for the T20 World Cup 2022, Ravi Shastri said India need a finisher after MS Dhoni's retirement from international cricket. "Karthik has got the experience, he has got all the shots," added Shastri. Karthik has scored 90 runs in three IPL 2022 matches at a strike rate of 204.54.

96.title: Japan recognises Covaxin to facilitate travel between both nations
96.article_body: Hyderabad-based Bharat Biotech informed on Friday that its COVID-19 vaccine, Covaxin, has been recognised by Japan. "The government of Japan has included Bharat Biotech's Covaxin in the list of recognised vaccines to further facilitate travel from India to Japan starting April 10, 2022," the company tweeted. This development was also confirmed by Indian Embassy in Japan.

97.title: 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse...' to release in India on May 6
97.article_body: 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness' from the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU) is set to release in India on May 6. The upcoming film will release in multiple languages, including English, Hindi, Tamil, Telugu, Kannada and Malayalam. The Sam Raimi directorial stars Benedict Cumberbatch, Rachel McAdams, Elizabeth Olsen and Chiwetel Ejiofor among others in pivotal roles.

98.title: Glamour isn't the reason why I joined films: Vidya on playing de-glam roles
98.article_body: Vidya Balan, while talking about playing deglamorised roles in her recently released films, said she hasn't joined films because of glamour. "I'm here to tell stories and I am fortunate to get stories, which are very different from each other, each time," the actress said. Vidya further said that she only selects such projects which appeal to her.

99.title: There will be comparisons: Sonu Sood on replacing Rannvijay in 'Roadies'
99.article_body: Sonu Sood has opened up about replacing Rannvijay Singha as the host in the upcoming season of the youth-based reality show 'Roadies'. "When you step into someone else's shoes, there will be comparisons," he said. Sonu added while the "DNA of the show" remains the same, the scale is larger and the journey is more real and raw this time.

100.title: I've been Warner's fan, enjoyed my first outing with him vs LSG: DC's Shaw
100.article_body: Talking about his experience of batting with DC opener David Warner against LSG, teammate Prithvi Shaw said it was great fun. "Once we form a good understanding, it'll be even better to bat with him," he added. "I've been a fan of the way he strikes the ball," he further said. Openers Shaw and Warner scored 61 and 4 respectively.

101.title: Gross tax collections surge to record ₹27.07 lakh crore in FY22
101.article_body: Revenue Secretary Tarun Bajaj on Friday said that India's tax collections rose to a record high of ₹27.07 lakh crore between April 2021 and March 2022. He added that the revenue collection is almost ₹5 lakh crore above the Union Budget's estimates of ₹22.17 lakh crore. Direct tax collections in FY22 grew 49%, while indirect tax collections rose 30%.

102.title: Tom Hiddleston to star in and executive produce 'The White Darkness'
102.article_body: Actor Tom Hiddleston is set to star in and executive produce Apple's limited series 'The White Darkness'. According to Hollywood Reporter, the series is inspired by the true-life account of Lieutenant Colonel Henry Worsley, a former soldier who was deeply obsessed with adventure. The show will be penned by 'Pachinko' writer Soo Hugh who will also serve as executive producer.

103.title: Were confident about chase due to our batting depth: Bishnoi on LSG's win
103.article_body: Following LSG's six-wicket win against DC in IPL 2022, LSG spinner Ravi Bishnoi said he was confident about his side's batting depth while chasing the 150-run target. "The game got a little tight towards the end, but we still had Jason Holder and Krishnappa Gowtham to come," he added. LSG scored 155/4 in 19.4 overs.

104.title: Tribal women protest against cashew crop destruction in Andhra Pradesh
104.article_body: Tribal women staged a protest against alleged destruction of their cashew plantations by a mining company at Urlova village in Andhra Pradesh on Thursday. As a part of their symbolic protest, they imitated the act of suicide by hanging through a tree, saying they would be left with no choice but to end their lives if their plantations weren't saved.

105.title: Woman wins ₹75 cr lottery after accidentally buying wrong ticket in US
105.article_body: A woman won a $10 million (around ₹75 crore) lottery after she accidentally bought the wrong lottery ticket as a person bumped into her while she was trying to purchase a different ticket in California. As per the woman, the person bumped into her while she was selecting the ticket options and ended up buying a $30 ticket.

106.title: We were brilliant with the ball: KL Rahul on LSG's win over DC
106.article_body: After Lucknow Super Giants defeated Delhi Capitals by six wickets, LSG skipper KL Rahul said that his bowlers were "brilliant with the ball" and called the win a "complete team effort". "In the powerplay, we obviously need to go back and work on. But...we assessed things well after that and bowled better," Rahul said.

107.title: Microsoft says it disrupted Russian cyberattacks on Ukraine, EU, US
107.article_body: Microsoft has revealed that it disrupted hacking attempts by a group it nicknamed "Strontium", a Russian GRU-connected actor, aimed at breaking into Ukrainian, European Union, and American targets. The group was using seven internet domains as part of an effort to spy on Ukrainian institutions, government bodies and think tanks in the US and EU.

108.title: Show-cause notice issued to Pune hospital in kidney transplant case
108.article_body: A Pune-based hospital has received a show-cause notice over an alleged fraud during a kidney transplant procedure. The fraud reportedly occurred at Ruby Hall Clinic, where a woman allegedly posed as the wife of a man, who needed a transplant, and donated her kidney to a young woman. In return, the young woman's mother donated her kidney to the man.

109.title: Conor McGregor charged with 6 offences in driving arrest: Reports
109.article_body: UFC star Conor McGregor was charged with six offences for the dangerous driving case in which he was arrested in Dublin last month, reports said. McGregor reportedly faces two counts of dangerous driving and charges for driving without a licence, among others. Notably, the Irish fighter was released on bail and is due back in court on June 23.

110.title: BJP is conspiring to make Mumbai a Union Territory: Sanjay Raut
110.article_body: Senior Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Friday alleged that BJP is conspiring to make Mumbai a Union Territory. "A presentation...has been made to the MHA...This has been going on for the last two months and I am saying this with full responsibility," he said, adding that Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray is also aware of this development.

111.title: Sex on the basis of genuine promise to marry that didn't fructify not rape: Delhi HC
111.article_body: A sexual relationship on a genuine promise of marriage that fails to fructify due to external circumstances is not rape, said Delhi High Court. The court was dealing with a matter in which a man and a woman were in a long-term relationship and got engaged but the marriage couldn't be solemnised. The relationship had ended on hostile terms.

112.title: Love the show and Sharma sisters: Priyanka praises Netflix's 'Bridgerton'
112.article_body: Priyanka Chopra praised Netflix drama series 'Bridgerton' for representing Indian culture on the show. "It's so wonderful to see desi representation on mainstream TV. It was...an anomaly when I started. Love the show and the Sharma sisters," Priyanka wrote on Instagram Stories. Based on Julia Quinn's series of novels, 'Bridgerton' features Simone Ashley and Charithra Chandran among others.

113.title: Activision Blizzard makes 1,100 game testers full-time employees
113.article_body: Activision Blizzard has announced it'll make around 1,100 of its temporary and contract quality assurance workers in the US full-time employees, starting July 1. These employees also will be eligible to participate in bonus plan and will have access to full company benefits. "This change follows a process that began last year" across Activision Publishing and Blizzard, a spokesperson said.

114.title: Researchers identify over 5,500 new RNA viruses in the ocean
114.article_body: Researchers have identified at least 5,500 new RNA virus species from 35,000 water samples from oceans across the globe. With this discovery, scientists have doubled the number of known RNA virus phyla from five to 10 to capture the diversity of the new findings. RNA viruses are known to cause several diseases in humans ranging from common flu to COVID-19.

115.title: My mother has a lung disease, please give our dues: Fired BharatPe employee to CEO
115.article_body: A former BharatPe admin in a post said his mother has a lung disease and is hospitalised and he hasn't received his reimbursement for a few months. "I'm the oldest employee of BharatPe working day and night. Why were we thrown out of the company without any reason," Dhananjay Kumar asked CEO Suhail Sameer. "Please give our dues...back," he added.

116.title: She loves her country India: UK finance minister Sunak as he defends wife Akshata's tax
116.article_body: UK Chancellor of Exchequer Rishi Sunak defended his India-born wife Akshata Murthy amid controversy over her non-domicile tax status. Stating that it wasn't fair to ask his wife to sever her ties with India, Sunak said, "She loves her country. Like I love mine." "Every single penny that she earns in the UK she pays UK taxes on," he added.

117.title: We wanted to keep wickets in hand: De Kock after LSG's win over DC
117.article_body: Lucknow Super Giants opener Quinton De Kock said that his side "wanted to keep wickets in hand" while chasing down a target of 150 runs against Delhi Capitals on Thursday. "It was a chaseable score, but we made sure not to get too ahead of ourselves," said De Kock after scoring 80 runs from 52 balls.

118.title: Twitter staffer said staff would be probed if they tweeted like Musk: Report
118.article_body: A Twitter employee said that the platform's employees would be subjected to an HR investigation if they tweeted like Tesla Founder Elon Musk, The Washington Post reported. According to a Slack message, the employee asked if board members are "held to the same standard" as employees. Several Twitter employees are reportedly worried about Musk's addition to the platform's board.

119.title: Fire breaks out at Industrial Development Corporation in Madhya Pradesh
119.article_body: A fire broke out at the Centre for Entrepreneurship Development Madhya Pradesh (CEDMAP) and Madhya Pradesh Industrial Development Corporation (MPIDC) in Bhopal on Friday morning. "At around 6:00 am, we received the information about a fire breaking out at the office...we immediately sent two tenders to control it," a fire station official said. No casualties were reported in the incident.

120.title: England launch their new T20I jersey, share pics
120.article_body: England have launched their new T20I jersey, which will be worn by the England men's and women's teams at the upcoming T20 World Cups. The kit has been designed to enhance performance and ease of movement with fabrics that Castore have used across the highest level of their sportswear, the England and Wales Cricket Board said.

121.title: Can't leave India without permission: Court to ex-Amnesty India chief
121.article_body: A Delhi court on Friday ordered the former Amnesty International India Board chair Aakar Patel to not leave India without permission until a decision is taken on CBI's plea challenging the order to quash look out circular issued against him. The court also put on hold Thursday's order which ordered CBI to tender a written apology to Patel.

122.title: 'Naagin 6' actor Tusharr Khanna buys Audi A4 worth around ₹60 lakh
122.article_body: Actor Tusharr Khanna, who stars in Ekta Kapoor-backed show 'Naagin 6', has bought an Audi A4 worth around ₹60 lakh. He took to Instagram to share pictures of his new car. "I feel fortunate to have got love and adulation for my work which made me capable enough to own this today, can't thank well-wishers enough," Tusharr said.

123.title: My kids enjoy watching my films but they're not my fans: Sanjay Dutt
123.article_body: Actor Sanjay Dutt in an interview has revealed that his children enjoy watching his films but they are not his fans. Sanjay has a daughter Trishala with his first wife late actress Richa Sharma and twins Shahraan and Iqra with his wife Maanayata. In an earlier interview, he had stated that his biopic 'Sanju' is his twins' all-time favourite film.

124.title: Serena Williams hints at comeback, says 'I've got to play Wimbledon first'
124.article_body: Twenty three-time Grand Slam champion Serena Williams has hinted at making a comeback in this year's Wimbledon. When asked about her comeback by NFL player Aaron Rodgers, Serena said, "Wimbledon's before the US Open, I've got to play Wimbledon first." "We've been talking about my comeback...hyping me up and getting me ready for Wimbledon," the ex-world number one added.

125.title: Produce more children, else India will become 'Hindu-less': Yati Narsinghanand
125.article_body: Dasna Devi temple head priest Yati Narsinghanand, who is out on bail in Haridwar hate speech case, has urged Hindus to produce more children to prevent India from becoming "Hindu-less" in the coming decades. "Mathematical calculations state that a non-Hindu will become PM in 2029," he added. Narsinghanand called for a religious assembly in the Mathura-Govardhan region from August 12-14.

126.title: I promise fines for Muslims wearing headscarves: French presidential candidate
126.article_body: French presidential candidate Marine Le Pen on Thursday vowed to issue fines to Muslims who wear headscarves in public. "People will be given a fine in the same way that it is illegal to not wear your seat belt. It seems to me that the police are very much able to enforce this measure," she said.

127.title: A high-end designer told me 'That lehenga isn't for you': Yami
127.article_body: Actress Yami Gautam has revealed certain high-end designers refuse to give their outfits because you are not so and so. She added she was once told 'No, that lehenga is not for you' and when she asked why, they said, 'No, just doesn't work with that designer'. "It was so mean...how can you make someone feel so bad?" Yami said.

128.title: BJP conspiring to make Mumbai a UT, I have proof: Sanjay Raut
128.article_body: BJP is conspiring to make Mumbai a Union Territory (UT), Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said. "A presentation about the same has been made to the Ministry of Home Affairs...Meetings have been held...funds are being collected," he claimed. "This has been going on for the last two months...I have the proof to substantiate what I am saying," Raut further said.

129.title: We're confident of what we've made: Shahid on not releasing Jersey on OTT
129.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor, speaking about the decision to release 'Jersey' in theatres despite getting many offers from the OTT platforms, said, "We're confident of what we've made." "We made [it] with the intent of being viewed on...big screen," he added. "The emotionality of the film is such that it's best when viewed with a group of people," Shahid further said.

130.title: Rahul runs Cong round-the-clock, should be made party chief: Sharad Yadav
130.article_body: Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) leader Sharad Yadav backed Rahul Gandhi's name for the post of Congress President and said that he runs the party "round the clock".  "I think he should be made the party president. Only then can something big be done," Yadav said. Rahul Gandhi met Yadav today, weeks after he merged his LJD party with RJD.

131.title: Pink Floyd members reunite to release 1st song in 28 yrs to raise money for Ukraine
131.article_body: Pink Floyd members have reunited and are releasing their first song in almost 30 years to raise money for the people of Ukraine. The track 'Hey Hey Rise Up' features Pink Floyd members David Gilmour and Nick Mason along with Ukrainian singer Andriy Khlyvnyuk. This will be Pink Floyd's first original song since 1994's 'The Division Bell'.

132.title: UK targets 'lavish lifestyles' of Putin's daughters with new sanctions
132.article_body: The UK on Friday added Russian President Vladimir Putin's two daughters to its sanctions list in a bid to undermine the "lavish lifestyles of the Kremlin's inner circle" amid the Ukraine war. Katerina Tikhonova and Maria Vorontsova will be subjected to travel bans and asset freezes, the UK government said. Earlier, the US had imposed sanctions on Putin's daughters.

133.title: 2 suspected Pak spies give flat, iPhones to officials of US Prez's secret services
133.article_body: US has busted an alleged ISI cell of Pakistan trying to intrude into the American intelligence and security apparatus including Secret Service which is in charge of the security of the President. The suspected Pakistani spies, Arian Taherzadeh and Haider Ali, allegedly provided members of the US Secret Service with rent-free flats, iPhones, surveillance systems among other things

134.title: Regret that I didn't do it sooner: Khloe Kardashian on getting a nose job
134.article_body: Khloe Kardashian recently talked about getting a nose job on 'The Kardashians: An ABC News Special'. Khloe said she always wanted to get a nose job. "But it's in the middle of your face and it's scary to think about," she told host Robin Roberts. "My only regret is...I didn't do it sooner," she said while responding to a fan.

135.title: Rohit got frustrated against Umesh who is currently all over him: Hogg
135.article_body: Reacting to Rohit Sharma's 12-ball 3 in MI's IPL 2022 defeat against KKR, ex-Australia spinner Brad Hogg said Rohit got frustrated while facing Umesh Yadav who is currently "all over" the MI captain. Umesh dismissed Rohit for the fifth time in IPL history during the match. Umesh is IPL 2022's current Purple Cap holder with nine wickets in four matches.

136.title: Probably the find of IPL 2022 so far: Jaffer on LSG batter Badoni
136.article_body: Praising Ayush Badoni, Wasim Jaffer said the 22-year-old LSG batter is probably the find of IPL 2022 so far. Badoni came to bat with five needed off five balls, hitting a four and a six to help LSG win by six wickets against DC on Thursday. He added that Badoni looks like a "real talent" with the way he finished.

137.title: Sex racket operating in guise of spa busted in Pune; 3 women rescued
137.article_body: Police have busted a sex racket that was being operated in the guise of a massage and spa centre in Pune's Baner. After receiving a tip-off, police sent a decoy customer to the Divine Spa Centre and later carried out a raid at the centre. Subsequently, police rescued three women and arrested four persons, including the manager of the centre.

138.title: 'Dragon-like' sea creature captured by fisherman in Norway, pic goes viral
138.article_body: A Russian fisherman has shared a picture of a sea creature that resembles a baby dragon, captured by him from the Norwegian Sea. Roman Fedortsov caught the creature, whose pictures have gone viral online, while fishing off the coast of Tromsø in Norway. It has reportedly been identified as a chimaera, a cartilaginous fish also known as a 'ghost shark'.

139.title: I got shouted at so many times: Jacqueline recalls shooting for song in Aladin
139.article_body: Actress Jacqueline Fernandez recalled shooting for a song with Amitabh Bachchan in her debut film 'Aladin', and said, "I had no idea what I was doing, I got shouted at so many times on sets." "It was great to be thrown into that because it made me realise...if I want to be in this industry...I should...work my hardest," Jacqueline added.

140.title: GT may not consider Vijay Shankar after PBKS match: Aakash Chopra
140.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra said GT may not consider Vijay Shankar for selection after their IPL 2022 match against PBKS. "He is neither picking wickets with the ball nor is he scoring runs with the bat and number three is an important slot," added Aakash. "At number three, if he gets an opportunity, this will be Shankar's last innings," stated Aakash.

141.title: 3 Shanghai officials sacked over COVID-19 response amid lockdown
141.article_body: Three local officials in Shanghai were sacked over a slack response to the COVID-19 outbreak in China's financial hub. An official notice didn't give details of the allegations against the officials but said their failure to fulfil their duties led to a "serious impact" on efforts to control the outbreak. Shanghai has placed its 26 million residents under lockdown.

142.title: MI will now realise the impact of a strong bowling attack: Mohammad Kaif
142.article_body: Reacting to MI recording their third defeat in a row in IPL 2022, ex-India batter Mohammad Kaif said MI will now realise the impact of a strong bowling attack. PBKS will take on GT today with pacer Mohammad Shami a part of the latter's squad. "With the new ball, there isn't a more dangerous bowler than Shami," added Kaif.

143.title: Don't give a crap about selection: Usman Khawaja on white-ball cricket
143.article_body: Australia batter Usman Khawaja said he has stopped giving a crap about selection for white-ball cricket, after being dropped from the white-ball squad despite averaging 50. "I was the second or third-highest run-scorer in that calendar year in white-ball cricket," added Khawaja. "If they want to pick me, they can pick. If they don't, my head's not...there," stated Khawaja.

144.title: Congress councillor held for beating up merchant in Kerala's Kochi
144.article_body: A Congress councillor, Tibin Devassy, was arrested for allegedly beating up a local merchant and forcibly taking away money from him in Kerala's Kochi, police said. The Island South councillor was arrested along with two other accused. The merchant alleged that Devassy and others kidnapped and beat him up, and forcibly made him transfer ₹2 lakh to their bank account.

145.title: Rare white kangaroo spotted in Australia, pics go viral
145.article_body: A rare white kangaroo was spotted in outback Queensland, Australia by a local. It was spotted by Nogo Station resident Sarah Kinnon. "I was just out with my husband, we were dropping some rams back to the paddock...It was pretty incredible, if you put a white sheet of paper next to it, that's how white it was," she said.

146.title: He won't be successful playing responsibly: Sehwag on Pant's 36-ball 39*
146.article_body: Reacting to DC captain Rishabh Pant's unbeaten 39 off 36 balls in the loss against LSG, Virender Sehwag said Pant won't be successful in IPL 2022 if he plays responsibly. "Pant should come and hit the ball and if he misses he goes back," added Sehwag. "Pant should look at his own videos...[which] can help him gain confidence," stated Sehwag.

147.title: BIAL, Amazon Web Services to collaborate for innovation centre at B'luru airport
147.article_body: The Bangalore International Airport Limited (BIAL) is working with Amazon Web Services (AWS), to establish a Joint Innovation Centre (JIC) at Kempegowda International Airport to drive the development and adoption of digital solutions in aviation. "This is the first JIC by AWS established outside China and its first JIC dedicated to advancing the aviation industry," BIAL said in a statement.

148.title: How have players bought for at least ₹10 crore in IPL mega auction performed so far?
148.article_body: MI's Ishan Kishan, the most expensive buy in IPL 2022 mega auction at ₹15.25 crore, has scored 149 runs so far. KKR captain Shreyas Iyer (₹12.25 crore) has scored 69 runs. PBKS' Liam Livingstone (₹11.5 crore) has scored 98 runs and has taken two wickets. DC's Shardul Thakur (₹10.75 crore) has conceded 118 runs in 11.4 overs with one wicket.

149.title: Cracked skull, almost died doing stunt for 'Armour of God': Jackie Chan
149.article_body: Jackie Chan revealed that he cracked his skull open and almost died performing a stunt for 1986 film 'Armour of God'. He said he was supposed to drink beer from a can before jumping into a tree but had to retake the scene and got drunk. When he leaped towards the tree, the branches snapped and he fell, Jackie added.

150.title: Pooja Bhatt to star in Sudhanshu Saria's 'Sanaa'
150.article_body: Pooja Bhatt is set to star in Sudhanshu Saria's women-oriented film 'Sanaa'. While talking about the film, Pooja said it is an "astonishingly perceptive" film which examines the lives of women "as we actually live it and not in a way the world thinks or wishes that we do". 'Sanaa' will also feature Radhika Madan, Shikha Talsania and Sohum Shah.

151.title: Man shot at while resisting robbery bid at Ghaziabad jewellery shop
151.article_body: A 37-year-old man was shot at by two armed men when he tried to resist their robbery attempt at his father's jewellery shop in Ghaziabad's Nehru Nagar area on Thursday. The victim, who's said to be critical, sustained a gunshot on the upper abdomen. Meanwhile, police have launched an investigation into the matter and are trying to trace the accused.

152.title: Zerodha CEO promises half month's pay to staff who lose weight, shares post
152.article_body: Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath tweeted that employees with a BMI under 25 will get half a month's salary as a bonus. He added that while the average BMI of the team is 25.3, if it's under 24 by August, everyone will get another half a month's salary as a bonus. He also invited other companies to compete in this.

153.title: They don't exist for me: Divya Agarwal on trolls, negative comments
153.article_body: Actress Divya Agarwal while talking about being targeted by online trolls and negative comments, said, "I've...not seen them (trolls) in their real self. So for me, they don't exist." Further, Divya said that while she is grateful for the positive messages, she does not let them affect her as well. "I'm clear in balancing the positive and negative," she added.

154.title: Man kills labourer to frame girlfriend in Mumbai, arrested
154.article_body: A 40-year-old man was arrested by Ambernath Police for allegedly murdering an unknown labourer to frame his girlfriend of 15 years in the murder case. He suspected she was having an affair and wanted revenge. He even dropped her voter ID card on the body. After interrogating the woman, police learned she was not involved in the crime.

155.title: BharatPe CEO was drunk when he accused me of stealing money: Ashneer
155.article_body: Ashneer Grover said BharatPe CEO Suhail Sameer must prove that he wasn't "under the influence of alcohol and drugs" when he accused Grover of stealing money from the company. "The said reply was put (on LinkedIn)...after a night of drunken debauchery by Suhail at BharatPe's offsite in Goa," Grover alleged. He demanded that Suhail be put on leave of absence.

156.title: 4 members of family including 2 children killed as AC explodes in Karnataka
156.article_body: A couple and their two children were killed due to an explosion in an air conditioner (AC) in a village in Karnataka's Vijayanagara district. A preliminary probe has revealed that the fire broke out after gas leaked from the AC vent, triggering an electric short circuit, which further led to an explosion. The entire house was also gutted in fire.

157.title: India's PV Sindhu, Kidambi Srikanth reach 2022 Korea Open semis
157.article_body: Indian shuttlers PV Sindhu and Kidambi Srikanth entered the 2022 Korea Open semi-finals in the women's singles and men's singles events respectively at Palma Stadium on Friday. Third seeded Sindhu beat seventh seeded Busanan Ongbamrungphan of Thailand 21-10, 21-16 in 44 minutes in the quarter-finals. Meanwhile, Kidambi Srikanth, seeded fifth, defeated Son Wanho 21-12, 18-21, 21-12 in 62 minutes.

158.title: It's a big deal AR Rahman approved Tiger Shroff's singing: Nadiadwala
158.article_body: Producer Sajid Nadiadwala has revealed that Tiger Shroff will be singing for AR Rahman by voicing the song 'Miss Hairan' in 'Heropanti 2'. Sajid further said it's a big deal that Rahman has approved him, adding that Tiger has been singing since school. "Knowing Tiger, I am sure he must have given a test for his singing too," he added.

159.title: BJP trying to take India in direction of a crisis similar to Sri Lanka: Gehlot
159.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot has said that the BJP-led Centre is trying to take India in the direction of an economic crisis similar to Sri Lanka. "In Sri Lanka, people do not have food because there too the attention was diverted in the name of nationalism...The Modi government is trying to take India in the same direction," Gehlot said.

160.title: Largest annual rise of atmospheric methane seen since 1983: NOAA
160.article_body: Scientists observed the largest annual increase of atmospheric methane in 2021 since systematic measurements began in 1983, NOAA said. The increase last year was 17 parts per billion (ppb). Atmospheric methane levels averaged around 162% greater than pre-industrial levels in 2021. Scientists estimate global methane emissions in 2021 were 15% higher than in the 1984-2006 period.

161.title: All aged above 18 can take precaution dose against COVID-19 from April 10
161.article_body: The government on Friday said that everyone above the age of 18 years can take the precaution dose of COVID-19 vaccines from April 10, 2022, onward. The dose can be taken by those eligible at private vaccination centres, the Health Ministry said. It can be taken nine months after the administration of the second dose, it added.

162.title: Punjab Police books Delhi BJP spokesperson Naveen Kumar Jindal
162.article_body: Punjab Police on Thursday booked Delhi BJP spokesperson Naveen Kumar Jindal for sharing a doctored video of Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal. In the video, Kejriwal is heard saying that he now takes money from corruption, along with Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann and other AAP MLAs. "After winning Punjab, Kejriwal thinks of Punjab Police as his father's grandson," Jindal tweeted.

163.title: 20 kids fall ill at Ghaziabad society; water contamination suspected
163.article_body: Nearly 20 children reportedly fell sick at Landcraft Golflinks, a residential society, in Ghaziabad on Wednesday, prompting health department officials to send their teams for checkups. Officials suspect consumption of contaminated water may have been the cause of the sickness as residents have alleged impurities in the society's water tank. Meanwhile, water samples have been sent for lab testing.

164.title: Told journalist to strip down to underwear to prevent suicide: MP policeman
164.article_body: After a picture of a journalist along with some other people stripped half-naked at a police station in Madhya Pradesh's Sidhi went viral, police said it was done from a "safety point of view". The men were "kept in underwear...so that they did not die by suicide [using] their clothes", the SHO of Kotwali Police Station Manoj Soni said.

165.title: Video shows car turning turtle after jumping red light in Hyd
165.article_body: The Cyberabad Traffic Police on Friday shared a video from Kompally, Alwal in Hyderabad, showing how jumping a red light at night is not safe. The video shows a speeding car hitting an auto after jumping the red light. After the crash, the car turned turtle. Police revealed that the auto driver and co-passenger suffered minor injuries.

166.title: At least 35 dead as 2 rockets hit train station used for evacuations in Ukraine
166.article_body: At least 35 people have died and around 100 others have been injured after two rockets hit a train station that was being used for civilian evacuations in eastern Ukrainian city of Kramatorsk. Earlier this month, Russia accused Ukraine of carrying out an airstrike on a fuel depot in the Russian city of Belgorod.

167.title: Completion of womanhood requires giving birth: HC on parole to man to procreate
167.article_body: Rajasthan High Court has granted a 15-day parole to a man currently serving a life sentence for murder on the grounds of want of progeny. Citing Hindu philosophy of four Purusharths, namely Dharma, Artha, Kama and Moksha, the court observed that "for a married woman, completion of womanhood requires giving birth to a child".

168.title: Himachal ministers, MLAs will now pay tax as 5-decade-old practice ends
168.article_body: The Himachal Pradesh cabinet has now decided to end the five-decade-old practice of the state bearing the income tax amount on salaries and allowances paid to its ministers and legislators. This decision comes after the Himachal Pradesh High Court sought response from the state government on a PIL challenging the provisions of Himachal Pradesh Legislative Assembly allowing such exemptions.

169.title: Over ₹10 cr collected by Pune railway division from passengers as penalty
169.article_body: The Pune railway division has collected ₹10.94 crore in fines from passengers for travelling without tickets from 2021-22. According to the Pune railway division, almost 2,17,633 passengers were penalised for not having a ticket. "If the passenger is unable to pay the fine, then they will be arrested by the railway police," said Manoj Jhawar, Pune railway division spokesperson.

170.title: Pic of horse travelling in a crowded train in West Bengal goes viral, probe ordered
170.article_body: A photo of a horse standing inside a crowded local train in West Bengal is being widely circulated on social media. While the Railways has ordered a probe into the incident, a fact-check of the photo has also been ordered. The horse was reportedly returning after taking part in a race in Baruipur with its owner.

171.title: 3 Adani Group firms get ₹15,400 crore investment from Abu Dhabi's IHC
171.article_body: Adani Enterprises announced on Friday that Abu Dhabi-based conglomerate International Holding Company PJSC (IHC) will invest $2 billion as primary capital in three Adani Group companies. IHC will invest ₹3,850 crore in Adani Green Energy, ₹3,850 crore in Adani Transmission, and ₹7,700 crore in Adani Enterprises. The boards of the companies have approved the transaction, Adani Enterprises said.

172.title: Sonu Sood granted Dubai Golden Visa, actor says 'I'm grateful'
172.article_body: Actor Sonu Sood has been granted the Dubai Golden Visa. "I'm incredibly honoured and grateful to...Dubai government for Golden Visa. Dubai has been one of my favourite destinations to visit. It's a dynamic place to thrive. I'm thankful to...authorities for the privilege," he said on receiving the Golden Visa. Boney Kapoor and his family also hold the Dubai Golden Visa.

173.title: Mahindra's deal to sell SsangYong to S Korea's Edison terminated
173.article_body: Mahindra & Mahindra's deal to sell its subsidiary SsangYong Motor to South Korean electric carmaker Edison Motors has been terminated. Edison's inability to deposit the bid amount led to the termination of the deal, Mahindra said in an exchange filing. Mahindra owned about 75% of SsangYong as of September-end 2021, which it bought in 2010.

174.title: Dealer who supplied gun to Northeast Delhi riot accused held
174.article_body: A firearms dealer was arrested by the Delhi Police for allegedly supplying a pistol to Shahrukh Khan, who is accused of rioting during the Northeast Delhi riots in 2020. "Babu Wasim had been absconding for over two years... Wasim has admitted to having supplied the said pistol... to Shahrukh Khan prior to the riots," Jasmeet Singh, DCP Special Cell, said.

175.title: Shark Tank India pitchers rejected by Ashneer Grover meet up, fans react
175.article_body: Shark Tank India pitchers Rohit Warrier and Niti Singhal, who were rejected by Ashneer Grover, recently met  and posted a video of their meeting on Instagram. "Weird pitches? Not so weird now!" Niti wrote in the caption. "Divided by Shark Tank united by Ashneer," a person commented while another comment read, "When two people have common enemies, they become friends."

176.title: Veteran actress Sripriya's daughter Sneha gets married to Anmol Sharma
