176.article_body: Sneha Sethupathi, daughter of actors Rajkumar Sethupathi and Sripriya, got married to Anmol Sharma in Chennai. A few pictures from their wedding have also surfaced online. According to reports, the pre-wedding festivities started on April 4, and the duo tied the knot on April 6. The wedding was attended by R Sarath Kumar, Radikaa Sarathkumar, Khushbu Sundar and others.

177.title: EU President, diplomatic chief travelling to Kyiv amid conflict
177.article_body: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen said she is travelling to Ukraine's capital Kyiv, along with the bloc's diplomatic chief Josep Borrell and Slovak PM Eduard Heger. She is the most senior Western leader to go to Kyiv since Russia began invading Ukraine on February 24. She will hold talks with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy during the visit.

178.title: Elderly man, 3 sons rape his 17-yr-old foster daughter in Chennai, booked
178.article_body: Police booked a 65-year-old man along with his three sons, aged 39, 29 and 24 for allegedly raping his 17-year-old foster daughter. The girl's biological parents had sold her to a couple when she was one month old. Her youngest foster brother sexually abused her when she was 15, later, the other accused also started raping her repeatedly, police said.

179.title: Sec 144 imposed in Assam's Sivasagar as measure to avert anti-social activities
179.article_body: Amid concerns over the law and order situation, the district administration has imposed Section 144 in Assam's Sivasagar, along with a night curfew along the state border with Nagaland, to prevent anti-social activities. The restrictions will remain enforced for the next 60 days or until further notice. Officials have also prohibited pillion-riding on two-wheeler vehicles, with certain exemptions.

180.title: Teen electrocuted to death while taking selfie atop train engine in MP
180.article_body: A 16-year-old boy was electrocuted to death while taking a selfie atop a stationary train engine at Chhatarpur Railway Station in Madhya Pradesh, an official said. "The victim tried to grab an overhead high tension electricity line, which was charged," Railway Protection Force (RPF) inspector Jitendra Kumar said. A few youths manhandled the station master following the incident.

181.title: Woman fearing safety pretends to order pizza on 999 in UK, gets man arrested
181.article_body: A man was arrested after a woman fearing for her safety called 999 and pretended to order a pizza while they were on a bus in the UK. Sensing that the woman was in danger, the police asked her yes or no questions. She was then rescued after the police traced her location using tracking data and arrested the man.

182.title: Always a question mark on Shubman's power-hitting, strike rate: Jaffer
182.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer said there is always a question mark on GT opener Shubman Gill's power-hitting and strike rate, but termed his 46-ball 84 against DC at a strike rate of 182.60 as outstanding. Talking about Vijay Shankar, Jaffer stated it's a matter of concern that Shankar got the chance to bat at the number three position for GT.

183.title: Don't buy into phrases like '2 bodies 1 life' for married couples: Vidya Balan
183.article_body: Talking about gender imbalance in society, Vidya Balan said, "When a couple gets married...people use sentences like '2 bodies 1 life' and I keep saying, 'Listen...please don't buy into that because do jism aur aadmi ki jaan...humari jaan rehti nahi hai'." "There's a change in the way we women are looking at ourselves...what we want from our lives," added Vidya.

184.title: Police officers can't use battalion personnel as domestic help: Assam govt
184.article_body: No Assam Police officer will be allowed to use any battalion personnel as domestic help, the Assam government said. The state government added that if any officer is found using battalion personnel for personal, household works then they will have to pay their salary, the government won't pay. "We want to abolish this system," Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said.

185.title: Ukraine forces now in control of Sumy region bordering Russia: Governor
185.article_body: Ukrainian forces are now in control of the entire northeast region of Sumy along the border with Russia, its governor claimed. "The area is free of orcs," Dmytro Zhyvytsky said, on Facebook, referring to invading Russian troops. However, he warned residents that "the region isn't safe as there are many areas that have been mined and are still not cleared".

186.title: Paytm-backer Elevation Capital raises $670 mn, its largest India fund
186.article_body: Early-stage investor Elevation Capital, which has backed Swiggy and Paytm, among other Indian startups, has closed its latest India-dedicated fund at $670 million, its largest-ever. Elevation said it would look to deploy the fresh capital over a three-year time frame. It will invest in sectors such as consumer internet, fintech, SaaS, apart from emerging themes such as Web3 and cryptocurrency.

187.title: Ajmer bans loudspeakers at religious places to curb noise pollution
187.article_body: Ajmer district administration banned the use of loudspeakers in public and religious places with effect from April 7 to curb noise pollution. Violators who don't abide by the order will be booked under IPC section 188 (Disobedience to order duly promulgated by public servant), the notice read. The administration had earlier banned religious flags and banners in the district.

188.title: Russian forces have fully withdrawn from northern Ukraine: UK
188.article_body: Russian forces have fully withdrawn from northern Ukraine to Belarus and Russia, UK's Ministry of Defence said on Friday. At least some of these Russian forces will be transferred to East Ukraine to fight in the Donbas, it added. "Russian shelling of cities in the east and south continues," the ministry further said.

189.title: Over 5 B'luru schools get bomb threats via email; bomb squads conduct searches
189.article_body: Bengaluru Police Commissioner Kamal Pant on Friday said that more than five schools in the city have received bomb threats through emails. There is a drill and as per that the bomb squads have reached the spots and are conducting checks, Pant added. As per reports, no explosive material has been found at any of the schools so far.

190.title: Train runs over 3 youths trying to make Instagram reel in Tamil Nadu
190.article_body: Three youths died after a passenger train ran over them near Tamil Nadu's Chengalpattu when they were trying to make an Instagram reel. Police said one of the deceased is a college student, while another is a daily wage worker. "We are going through their social media profiles to check if they had uploaded similar videos earlier," an officer said.

191.title: 4th pillar of democracy dismantled: Rahul on journalists stripped in MP
191.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi criticised the Madhya Pradesh government after photos of journalists forced to strip to their undergarments at a police station in Sidhi went viral on social media. "The fourth pillar of democracy ‍was dismantled in the lockup! Either sit in the lap of the government and sing their praises or go to jail," Rahul Gandhi tweeted.

192.title: I started shivering when Dhoni asked me to bowl: Harbhajan on 2011 WC semi vs Pakistan
192.article_body: Former India off-spinner Harbhajan Singh has revealed that he started shivering when MS Dhoni asked him to bowl in the second spell in the 2011 World Cup semi-final against Pakistan. "They were batting really well at that stage. He asked me to bowl after the drinks break. I did not want to show people the pressure," Harbhajan added.

193.title: Kashmiri Pandits stopped from attending event on 'The Kashmir Files' in Pune
193.article_body: Two Kashmiri Pandit community members in Pune were allegedly stopped by police from attending an event on 'The Kashmir Files', said Rohit Kachroo, national coordinator of 'India 4 Kashmir'. The members wanted to ask some questions related to Kashmiri Pandit issues, Kachroo added. "Our purpose was to not let any law and order situation arise," a senior police inspector said.

194.title: Singapore jails Australian for throwing wine bottle, killing Muslim man
194.article_body: A Singapore court sentenced an Australian man to five-and-a-half years in prison for throwing a wine bottle and killing a 73-year-old Muslim man in 2019, saying it was an act of "religious hostility toward Muslims". Andrew Gosling had pleaded guilty to throwing the bottle at a Muslim family group as he was "angry" over ISIS attacks in Bali and Melbourne.

195.title: Ad in Delhi reads 'Russian@20000/-, p**sy@2000/-'; women panel chief posts video
195.article_body: A digital advertisement board at a store in Delhi was allegedly hacked after which obscene advertisements were flashed on it. Delhi Commission for Women chief Swati Maliwal shared a video showing the LED board running the advertisement of a spa, that read, "Russian@20000/-, p**sy@2000/-." "Shameful...Spas are not at all scared by MCD and Delhi Police," Maliwal wrote.

196.title: US Speaker Nancy Pelosi tests COVID-19 +ve, Asia trip delayed
196.article_body: US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi has postponed a planned congressional trip to Asia after she tested positive for COVID-19 on Thursday. On Wednesday, the 82-year-old was seen at a White House event with US President Joe Biden while not wearing a mask. The White House said that the President has tested negative for COVID-19 after coming into contact with Pelosi.

197.title: RBI won't do anything that goes against sanctions on Russia: Governor Das
197.article_body: During a press conference following the RBI monetary policy announcement, Governor Shaktikanta Das said that RBI "will not do anything that goes against the sanctions" on Russia. Das added, "If and when some rupee-ruble trade mechanism is worked out, you will get to know. We are sensitive to the sanctions." Earlier, India bought oil from Russia at discounted rates.

198.title: Twitter to test letting users 'unmention' themselves in tweets
198.article_body: Twitter will be testing a way to help users "unmention" themselves in tweets. It's doing so to help users "protect" their "peace" and remove themselves from conversations they don't want to be a part of. The experimental offering is limited to the web for now. Twitter has described the test as global but "small".

199.title: IT dept attaches 41 properties linked to Sena leader Yashwant Jadhav
199.article_body: Income Tax department has attached 41 properties linked to Shiv Sena leader and Chairman of the Standing Committee of Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation, Yashwant Jadhav, ANI reported. He is accused of tax evasion, the report added. The attached properties include 31 flats in Byculla's Bilkhadi Chamber Building, a flat worth ₹5 crore in Bandra and Hotel Crown Imperial in Byculla.

200.title: I can't romance Alia Bhatt: Sanjay Dutt on embracing his age
200.article_body: Sanjay Dutt has said he believes in moving with the times and embracing his age. "I can't romance Alia Bhatt," the 62-year-old actor said, adding, "You've to come to terms with it...You've got to move on." Sanjay further said he admires the younger generation of actors, like Alia and her partner Ranbir Kapoor, with whom he'll be seen in 'Shamshera'.

201.title: Liquorice may help with cancer treatment: Study
201.article_body: Liquorice, a popular candy, may help in preventing and treating certain types of cancers, a study stated. Researchers have found that a substance, glycyrrhizin, derived from the liquorice plant, Glycyrrhiza glabra has great anti-inflammatory and anti-cancer properties. They are studying liquorice further to determine if it could be used to prevent or stop the growth of prostate cancer.

202.title: BJP MLA Nitesh Rane refuses to file bond of good behaviour to Mumbai Police
202.article_body: BJP MLA Nitesh Rane, booked in a case over his statements about Disha Salian's death case investigation, refused to furnish a bond of good behaviour with Mumbai Police and termed the show cause notice "bad in law". Assistant Commissioner of Police Shailendra Dhivar had issued the notice to the BJP MLA asking him to execute a good behaviour bond.

203.title: US Army suspends SpaceX's application to expand Texas launch site
203.article_body: The US Army Corps of Engineers has suspended SpaceX's application for an expansion of its South Texas launch site after it failed to provide requested information. "Without the requested information, the permit process cannot continue," the Army Corps said. The information that officials have sought includes any impacts associated with SpaceX's plans and data on endangered or threatened species.

204.title: Senate confirms Jackson as first Black woman on US Supreme Court
204.article_body: The US Senate on Thursday confirmed Ketanji Brown Jackson to the Supreme Court, making her the first-ever Black female justice. The 51-year-old was confirmed by a 53-47 vote. US President Joe Biden called the confirmation "a historic moment for our nation". "We have taken another step toward making our highest court reflect the diversity of America," Biden said.

205.title: Faith steers us through stormy seas: RBI Governor quotes Gandhi in note on economy
205.article_body: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das concluded his monetary policy speech by quoting Mahatma Gandhi. "It is faith that steers us through stormy seas, faith that moves mountains and faith that jumps across the ocean," he said. Earlier, he said Russia-Ukraine war poses an "overwhelming challenge" and the RBI is "prepared to defend the Indian economy with all instruments at its command".

206.title: Navi Mumbai man denied pre-arrest bail for hiding homosexuality from wife
206.article_body: A court has rejected the pre-arrest bail application of a 32-year-old man from Navi Mumbai, who allegedly cheated his wife by hiding his homosexuality. The woman claimed that her husband allegedly forged a job offer letter, showing ₹14 lakh salary per annum, to impress her and also forced one of his gay partners to accompany them to their honeymoon.

207.title: MP govt planning to teach Bhagavad Gita in degree courses: CM Chouhan
207.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Thursday said the state government is planning to teach Bhagavad Gita in the second year of the degree course. "I have read Gita since childhood," Chouhan said, adding it teaches us to work without thinking about results. "This knowledge enables people to keep on working which...brings encouraging and constructive results," he said.

208.title: Delhi auto drivers call for a strike over CNG price hikes
208.article_body: Sections of auto drivers in Delhi have called for a strike on Friday over CNG price hikes, ANI reported. Associations of auto, cab and taxi drivers will hold protests at Jantar Mantar. "If we ask for ₹10-20 more from passengers, they get off the auto," an auto driver said. CNG price has increased by over ₹9 in seven days.

209.title: Mumbai's Haji Ali, Bandra-Worli sea-link at risk of submergence by 2050: Report
209.article_body: Around 998 buildings and 24 km of road length in Mumbai including Haji Ali dargah, Western Express Highway, Bandra-Worli sea-link, Queen's Necklace on Marine drive are at risk of submergence by 2050, as per the RMSI report. In addition to Mumbai, places in Kochi, Mangalore, Chennai, Visakhapatnam, and Thiruvananthapuram are also at risk of submergence, the report said.

210.title: Baba Ramdev rings opening bell as Ruchi Soya FPO shares list at 30% premium
210.article_body: Yoga guru Baba Ramdev and Patanjali CEO Acharya Balkrishna were seen ringing the opening bell at the BSE as Ruchi Soya's follow-on public offering shares listed on Friday. The shares opened at ₹855 on NSE and at ₹850 on BSE, giving over 30% premium to subscribers who were allotted shares. Before the FPO, Ramdev-led Patanjali owned 98.9% in Ruchi Soya.

211.title: People no longer come to Goa for drugs: Newly appointed Goa DGP
211.article_body: Goa's Director General of Police (DGP) Jaspal Singh, who took charge on Thursday, said people don't visit the coastal state for drugs any more, but for its beaches, culture and cuisine. "We don't want people to remember Goa for drugs," Singh said during his first press conference. He further said that various agencies need to coordinate to control drug cartels.

212.title: T'gana Chief Justice felicitates Hyd home guard for commitment towards duty
212.article_body: Chief Justice of Telangana High Court Satish Chandra Sharma on Friday felicitated Home Guard Ashraf Ali of Abids Traffic Police Station. The Chief Justice used to regularly watch Ali en route to the high court and appreciated his sense of commitment towards duty, Hyderabad Police said. Thus, while going to the High Court today, he felicitated Ali with a bouquet.

213.title: Rishabh Pant fined ₹12 lakh for slow over-rate against LSG
213.article_body: Delhi Capitals (DC) captain Rishabh Pant has been penalised after his team maintained a slow over-rate during their IPL 2022 match against Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) on Thursday. As it was DC's first offence of the season relating to over-rate, Pant was fined ₹12 lakh, the IPL said. LSG defeated DC by six wickets.

214.title: Singer Avril Lavigne gets engaged to boyfriend Mod Sun, shares proposal pics
214.article_body: Singer Avril Lavigne got engaged to her boyfriend Mod Sun in Paris. Avril took to Instagram to share pictures and revealed that the engagement happened on March 27. Commenting on Avril's post, Mod Sun wrote, "I love you so much...Forever and ever my angel." "It was the most perfect, romantic proposal I could ever ask for," Avril told 'People' magazine.

215.title: It is very, very important for every MI player to be desperate: Rohit
215.article_body: MI captain Rohit Sharma said it is very, very important for every MI player to be slightly desperate, with the franchise recently recording their third defeat in a row in IPL 2022. "We seriously cannot be blaming individuals," added Rohit. "We need to seize on the little opportunities during the game and get momentum," stated Rohit.

216.title: What will it take US to criticise Modi govt's actions against Muslims: US politician
216.article_body: US politician Ilhan Omar took to Twitter and wrote, "Why has Biden Administration been so reluctant to criticise Modi's government on human rights?" "What will it take US to criticise Modi govt's actions against Muslims?" she said in a video. "What does Modi need to do to [Muslims] before we will stop considering them a partner in peace?" she added.

217.title: Elon Musk to address Twitter staff in an 'ask me anything' session
217.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk, Twitter's largest shareholder, will be addressing Twitter employees at an 'ask me anything' session. "Many of you have had different types of questions about...Musk and I want to welcome you to ask those questions to him," Twitter CEO reportedly told staff in an email. The employees have reportedly raised concerns about Musk joining the board.

218.title: No restrictions imposed on news media in Jammu & Kashmir: Centre
218.article_body: Minister of Information and Broadcasting, Anurag Thakur, has said that the Centre has not imposed any restrictions on news media in Jammu & Kashmir.  "Home Ministry has informed that there have been no instances of any harassment to the media persons by the authorities since 2017," Thakur said while responding to a question in Rajya Sabha on Thursday.

219.title: End of BJP in K'taka, says ex-PM Deve Gowda amid loudspeaker issue
219.article_body: Former Prime Minister HD Deve Gowda has said that implementing the policy of banning the use of loudspeakers by religious sites will be an "end of BJP" in Karnataka. His comments came after the Bengaluru Police issued notices to 301 mosques, temples, churches, restaurants and other establishments to use their loudspeakers within the permissible decibel levels.

220.title: Delhi to get 19 more schools by the end of current financial year: Officials
220.article_body: Delhi will get 19 more schools with state-of-the-art facilities by the end of the current financial year and pre-construction work at several of these schools has started, officials said. The construction of two new schools in Southwest Delhi's Molarband and Gadda Colony area is nearing completion, officials added. Of the 19 schools, 11 will be Schools of Specialised Excellence (SoSE).

221.title: Earlier I could meet only 70% population, now I can meet 100%: Supriyo
221.article_body: TMC candidate for the Ballygunge Assembly by-poll, Babul Supriyo, has said that when he was in BJP, he could meet only "70% of the population" but now he is "free to meet 100%". "A communal stamp was imposed over my image. But it's not true," he said. Notably, West Bengal Imams Association has opposed Supriyo's candidature and called him "communal".

222.title: 66-year-old woman dies after son stabs her multiple times in Gurugram
222.article_body: A 66-year-old woman died after she was allegedly stabbed multiple times by her son in Gurugram's Shivpuri in the New Colony area on Thursday, police said. The incident took place when the victim went to give dinner to her son who lived in a separate house nearby. The exact motive for the murder is yet to be ascertained, police added.

223.title: Cardless cash withdrawal to be available at all banks, ATMs via UPI soon: RBI
223.article_body: While announcing RBI's monetary policy, Governor Shaktikanta Das said, "At present, the facility of cardless cash withdrawal through ATMs is limited only to a few banks." "It is now proposed to make cardless cash withdrawal facility available across all banks and ATM networks using the UPI," Das added. This would help prevent frauds such as card cloning, he stated.

224.title: HC orders CBI probe into TMC leader's murder that preceded Birbhum violence
224.article_body: The Calcutta High Court on Friday ordered the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) to probe TMC panchayat leader Bhadu Sheikh's murder, which allegedly led to violence in which nine persons were burnt to death in West Bengal's Birbhum. Earlier on March 25, the High Court had ordered a CBI investigation into the killings of the nine people in Bogtui village.

225.title: World's largest diamond miner & Russian shipbuilder sanctioned by US
225.article_body: The US has imposed sanctions on two Russian state-owned firms, Alrosa and United Shipbuilding Corp (USC), over Ukraine war. The USC "constructed...warships that...bombarded Ukraine", while Alrosa's proceeds helped "finance...Russian government's war", US State Department said. Alrosa, the world's largest diamond mining firm, accounts for 90% of Russia's diamond mining capacity, as per US Treasury.

226.title: Remove or place Ganesha idols 'respectfully' in Qutub complex: NMA to ASI
226.article_body: National Monuments Authority (NMA) Chairman Tarun Vijay said that the Ganesha idols placed "disrespectfully" in the Qutub Minar complex should either be removed or installed "respectfully". The former Rajya Sabha MP said that he had raised the issue with the Archaeological Survey of India (ASI) more than a year ago but is yet to receive a response to his letter.

227.title: Kuldeep knows he will play for DC no matter how he bowls: Sehwag
227.article_body: Virender Sehwag said chinaman bowler Kuldeep Yadav knows he will be a part of DC's lineup, no matter how he bowls for the franchise in matches. "DC don't have any other spinner to replace him," added Sehwag. Kuldeep has picked six wickets in three IPL 2022 matches so far and is DC's leading wicket-taker in the ongoing edition.

228.title: Jr NTR's next with Koratala Siva to be made on a budget of ₹300 cr: Report
228.article_body: Actor Jr NTR's upcoming film with filmmaker Koratala Siva will reportedly be made on a budget of ₹300 crore. According to the report, the yet-untitled project will also feature Alia Bhatt. It'll be shot over a period of six to seven months at multiple locations, the report said. Jr NTR and Alia recently shared screen space in SS Rajamouli's 'RRR'.

229.title: Made sure nobody stands at square leg when Pant's batting in nets: Kaif
229.article_body: Ex-DC assistant coach Mohammad Kaif said they would make sure nobody stands at square leg when Rishabh Pant was batting in the nets, as Pant's bat would go towards square leg if he lost control. "We used to move to the off-side knowing he would play fewer strokes...there," added Kaif. "Pant is one of my favourite players," stated Kaif.

230.title: Shah Rukh Khan pens handwritten letter to 'Pathaan' assistant director, pic surfaces
230.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan penned a handwritten letter to Abhishek Anil Tiwari, assistant director of his upcoming film 'Pathaan'. A picture of the letter has surfaced online, wherein Shah Rukh calls Abhishek "a gem". "I love the fact that you love your drinks. Have a good life in cinema...I will miss you lots," a part of the letter read.

231.title: Russia-Ukraine war could impede India's economic recovery: RBI Governor
231.article_body: While announcing RBI's monetary policy, Governor Shaktikanta Das said the Russia-Ukraine "war could potentially impede the economic recovery" and projected India's real GDP growth at 7.2% for 2022-23. Das added that financial market volatility induced by monetary policy normalisation in advanced economies and renewed COVID-19 infections in some countries "pose downside risks to the outlook".

232.title: He made the slow surface appear simple: De Kock on Shaw's 34-ball 61
232.article_body: LSG opener Quinton De Kock said DC batter Prithvi Shaw made the slow surface during their IPL 2022 match appear simple, scoring 61 runs off 34 balls at a strike rate of 179.41. Shaw's knock comprised nine fours and two sixes. De Kock was the match's top run-getter, scoring 80 runs off 52 balls at a strike rate of 153.84.

233.title: Russia bans Australian, New Zealand PMs from entering country
233.article_body: Russia has imposed entry bans on Australian PM Scott Morrison and New Zealand PM Jacinda Ardern after they imposed sanctions on Moscow over the Ukraine war. Russian Foreign Ministry accused Australia and New Zealand of "hostile actions" towards Russia. In total, Russia on Thursday barred 228 Australian lawmakers and government members and 130 New Zealand citizens from entering the country.

234.title: Ashneer writes to BharatPe, seeks action against CEO after 'Ashneer stole money' remark
234.article_body: Ashneer Grover has written to the BharatPe board saying that CEO Suhail Sameer should "immediately be put on leave of absence" and Chairman Rajnish Kumar should "immediately resign". Earlier, Suhail in response to a comment by Ashneer's sister on LinkedIn said, "Your brother stole all the money...Very little left to pay salaries." Ashneer also demanded a written apology from Suhail.

235.title: Girl's body found in car parked inside Asaram's ashram; was missing since April 5
235.article_body: The body of a 13-year-old girl, who was missing since April 5, was recovered from a car parked inside self-styled godman and rape convict Asaram Bapu's ashram in Uttar Pradesh. The police have sent the body for a post-mortem. A person from the ashram has been taken into custody by the police for questioning in the matter.

236.title: Impose Article 356, we will win by bigger margin: TMC's Abhishek Banerjee
236.article_body: TMC's National General Secretary Abhishek Banerjee claimed that his party will come back to power by winning 250 seats if Centre imposes Article 356 in Bengal. This statement comes after opposition parties have been calling for imposition of Article 356 in West Bengal after the Birbhum incident. "Many more leaders want to leave BJP and join our party," he added.

237.title: As heatwave continues in Rajasthan, Jalore records 45.2°C
237.article_body: At 45.2°C, Rajasthan's Jalore recorded the state's highest temperature on Thursday amid the heatwave, India Meteorological Department (IMD) said. A maximum temperature between 41°C-43°C was recorded in several parts of Rajasthan on Thursday. For the next five days, IMD has issued a yellow alert for heatwaves and an orange alert for severe heat waves in some parts of the state.

238.title: A cricketer born on 8-4-63 scored 8,463 runs in Test cricket
238.article_body: In a unique coincidence, former England captain Alec Stewart, who was born on 8-4-63 (April 8, 1963), smashed 8,463 runs in his Test career. Stewart is the most capped Test wicketkeeper for England, playing 133 matches from 1990 to 2003. Stewart also played 170 ODIs for England, scoring 4,677 runs including four hundreds and 28 fifties.

239.title: Didn't expect appreciation from the US: Rajamouli on 'RRR'
239.article_body: Director SS Rajamouli during an event opened up on his film, 'RRR', being appreciated by the western media and said that he didn't expect the US to praise the movie. "New York Times, too, has written about our film. The western audience, particularly in...US, is liking [it]. This is the kind of thing I take to my heart," Rajamouli added.

240.title: Incidents of cybercrime, fraud recorded fivefold jump between 2018 & 2021: Govt
240.article_body: Incidents of cybercrime and fraud recorded a fivefold jump between 2018 and 2021, the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (MeitY) informed a parliamentary panel. As per government data, the number of cybercrime incidents rose from 2,08,456 in 2018 to 14,02,809 in 2021. As many as 2,12,485 such cases were recorded in the first two months of 2022.

241.title: RBI hikes retail inflation projection to 5.7% in 2022-23
241.article_body: While announcing the RBI monetary policy, Governor Shaktikanta Das said retail inflation is projected to be higher at 5.7% in 2022-23 amid a spike in crude oil prices due to Russia-Ukraine tensions. Retail inflation, which is measured by Consumer Price Index, is expected to be at 6.3%, 5.8%, 5.4%, and 5.1% in the first, second, third and fourth quarter, respectively.

242.title: Man kills labourer to implicate girlfriend in case in Thane, arrested
242.article_body: A 40-year-old man was arrested by Thane police for allegedly killing an unknown labourer to implicate his girlfriend in the murder case. According to police, the accused, Waman Shinde, was in judicial custody and was out on bail for few days. He suspected his girlfriend of having an affair and murdered the labourer to take revenge on her, police added.

243.title: Tesla to make a futuristic-looking dedicated robotaxi: Elon Musk
243.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has said the firm will expand its "Full Self-Driving" beta software to all North American subscribers this year and will come up with a "dedicated robotaxi". He said the robotaxi is "going to look quite futuristic-looking". He made the announcement at a party to mark the opening of Tesla's $1.1 billion factory in Texas.

244.title: Ex-Maha Home Min Deshmukh 'mastermind' in money laundering case: ED
244.article_body: Former Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh is the "mastermind" in the money laundering case registered against him, Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Thursday said while opposing his bail plea in Bombay High Court. He had misused his position a lot and is hiding many important things, it added. "If granted bail, he can go out...tamper with the evidence," ED claimed.

245.title: Kerala lifts all COVID-19 restrictions; use of face masks to continue
245.article_body: In view of the current COVID-19 situation, the Kerala government on Thursday announced that all restrictions imposed in the state will be lifted with immediate effect. All advisories issued by the Centre's Ministry of Health and Family Welfare, including the use of face masks and hand hygiene, will continue to be in force, the state government added in a release.

246.title: RTI is not admission of government, answer depends on question posed: SC
246.article_body: Right to Information (RTI) is not an admission of the government as the answer provided depends on the question posed, Supreme Court said. "It's always misleading. What question is posed, depending upon that... answer is given. That's been our broad experience," it added. SC was hearing pleas over GST exemption for services provided by private tour operators to Haj pilgrims.

247.title: Ayush Badoni's Virat Kohli-like celebration after hitting match-winning six goes viral
247.article_body: LSG's 22-year-old batter Ayush Badoni's Virat Kohli-like celebration after hitting a match-winning six against DC has gone viral. Badoni was seen pointing towards his name on the jersey before pumping his fist. Kohli had celebrated in such a fashion when his 94*(50) helped India chase down a target of 208 in a T20I against West Indies in Hyderabad in 2019.

248.title: Over 3 crore houses constructed for the poor under Awas Yojana: PM Modi
248.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced the completion of 3 crore 'pucca' houses for the poor under the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana on Friday. "These houses...have...become a symbol of women empowerment today," PM Modi tweeted. These houses built in both rural and urban areas of the country are equipped with basic facilities like electricity, toilet, water and gas supply.

249.title: RBI cuts GDP growth projection to 7.2% for 2022-23 from 7.8% earlier
249.article_body: While announcing RBI's monetary policy, Governor Shaktikanta Das projected India's GDP growth at 7.2% in 2022-23, as against the previous projection of 7.8%. RBI expects GDP to grow at 16% in the first quarter of 2022-23, 6.2% in the second quarter, 4.1% in the third quarter and 4% in fourth quarter. Growth projections assume crude oil at $100/barrel, Das said.

250.title: Drew Barrymore dances to 'Chura Ke Dil Mera' with Lilly Singh, lip syncs to it
250.article_body: YouTuber Lilly Singh took to Instagram to share a video of herself and actress Drew Barrymore dancing to 'Chura Ke Dil Mera'. In the video, Drew can also be seen lip-syncing to a part of the song. "Didn't she nail this?! Ugh. A queen," Lilly wrote. "This is everything...Best thing I've seen in a long time," actress Freida Pinto commented.

251.title: Babar Azam overtakes Sachin Tendulkar in all-time ODI batting rankings
251.article_body: Pakistan captain Babar Azam has overtaken Sachin Tendulkar in all-time ODI batting rankings. Babar is now placed 15th on the list, having attained 891 rating points. Sachin is 16th on the list with 887 rating points. Ex-West Indies captain Viv Richards leads the all-time rankings with 935 rating points. Virat Kohli is sixth on the list with 911 rating points.

252.title: Hindu mahant threatens to kidnap Muslim women and publicly rape them in UP
252.article_body: A video showing a Hindu mahant threatening to kidnap Muslim women from their homes and publicly rape them has surfaced on social media. The mahant said this while addressing a gathering outside a mosque in Uttar Pradesh's Sitapur district. Police said a senior officer is investigating the matter and that action will be taken on the basis of facts.

253.title: Odisha journalist chained to hospital bed after arrest in assault case
253.article_body: A 50-year-old journalist was allegedly chained to a hospital bed on Thursday following his arrest in an assault case in Odisha's Balasore. A two-wheeler hit his motorcycle on Monday and an inspector said that an assault case was registered against him. The journalist accused the inspector of holding a grudge against him over the publication of a piece of news.

254.title: Allu Arjun to start shooting for 'Pushpa 2' in July: Report
254.article_body: Actor Allu Arjun will reportedly start shooting for the sequel to 'Pushpa: The Rise - Part 1' in July. The makers are planning to shoot some important scenes in the first schedule, the report stated. Srikanth Vissa, who penned the dialogues for the first part, is working on the second part as well. 'Pushpa 2' will be directed by Sukumar.

255.title: RBI keeps repo rate unchanged at 4%, reverse repo rate hiked to 3.50%
255.article_body: The RBI's Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) on Friday kept the repo rate unchanged at a record low of 4% and increased reverse repo rate to 3.50% amid geopolitical tensions between Russia and Ukraine. The repo rate was left unchanged during last MPC meeting in February 2022. This is the 11th consecutive time that the MPC has kept repo rate unchanged.

256.title: Like film where you're more confused after 3.5 hours: Joy on Pant's calls
256.article_body: Talking about DC captain Rishabh Pant's decisions in the loss against LSG, ex-KKR director Joy Bhattacharjya said it reminded him of an Andrei Tarkovsky film where you end up getting more confused after three-and-a-half hours. "It was an absolutely perplexing game. There are a lot of tricks that have been missed...It's the strangest of bowling cards," Joy added.

257.title: People from different states should speak in Hindi instead of English: Shah
257.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah has said that people from different states should communicate with each other in Hindi, instead of English. "Now the time has come to make the official language an important part of the unity of the country," he added. Shah, however, clarified that Hindi should be accepted as an alternative to English and not local languages.

258.title: UP govt to develop mobile app for modern education in madrassas
258.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh government has decided to develop a mobile application for imparting modern education to the students of madrassas. Further, biographies of great persons and freedom fighters would also be included in the curriculum. According to Minister of State for Minority Welfare, Danish Azad Ansari, the move will help in instilling the feeling of 'Rashtrabhakti' among the students.

259.title: Registration for Amarnath Yatra 2022 to start from April 11
259.article_body: Registration for Amarnath Yatra for the year 2022 will begin on April 11, said Nitishwar Kumar, CEO, Shri Amarnathji Shrine Board. "The pilgrims can...register online through the website and mobile app of the Shrine Board," he added. The offline registrations can be made across 446 branches of J&K bank, PNB, Yes Bank and 100 branches of SBI, Kumar informed.

260.title: China's Tencent cut CEO's pay by 25% in 2021, President's by 24%
260.article_body: China's Tencent Founder and CEO Pony Ma's pay dropped by 25% to $6.9 million in 2021, the firm's annual report showed. President Martin Lau's total pay dropped 24% to $50.7 million from $67.2 million the year before, including a 32% decline in his bonus. The firm also disclosed that the highest-paid individuals were not among the directors or senior executives.

261.title: From an AC technician to an expert trainer, meet Mobin: Urban Company
261.article_body: The latest episode of Urban Company Impact features AC technician Mobin, introduced as a man with responsibilities and ambition. He talks about his 18-year-long struggle, moving cities for work, living a lonely life until he joined Urban Company in Kolkata. The episode shows how he found a place valuing his skills and helping him grow to become an expert trainer.

262.title: 2 killed, 8 injured in terror attack at Israeli bar; US condemns shooting
262.article_body: At least two people were killed and eight others were injured after a man opened fire into a crowded bar in Israel's Tel Aviv on Thursday. Condemning the attack, Israeli PM Naftali Bennett said, "Security forces are in pursuit of the terrorist." "Wherever the terrorist is, we'll get to him," Bennett added. The US also condemned the "senseless" terrorist attack.

263.title: Shah Rukh Khan's look from upcoming film leaked online
263.article_body: A picture of Shah Rukh Khan from the set of a film has surfaced online, revealing his look from the upcoming project. In the picture, the actor can be seen sitting in a vehicle, with his face covered with a cloth. Reacting to the picture, a fan wrote, "So it's confirmed that SRK has begun the shoot of Atlee's 'Lion'."

264.title: Doubt if states will be able to pay salaries: Mamata Banerjee
264.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee once again criticised Centre's economic policies and said, "Country's economic situation is getting bad to worse, I doubt if states will be able to pay salaries in coming days." "The rise in fuel prices is affecting the lives of people. I request Centre to control fuel prices and temporarily stop collecting toll tax," she added.

265.title: Indian rat snake rescued from waste unit fire in Noida
265.article_body: A five-foot-long Indian rat snake, which was stranded in the aftermath of a fire in a waste collection unit in Sector-63, Noida was rescued, an NGO said. As per Wildlife SOS officials, the snake sustained minor burns on its mouth and body and is undergoing treatment. The Indian rat snake plays a very important role in the food chain.

266.title: Situation in Ukraine's Borodyanka more dreadful than Bucha: Zelenskyy
266.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Thursday said that the situation in the town of Borodyanka was "significantly more dreadful" than in nearby Bucha. There are "even more victims" of Russian troops in Borodyanka, Zelenskyy added. According to local officials, more than 300 people were killed by Russian forces in Bucha town, and around 50 of them were executed.

267.title: It's no secret that I am Sharad Pawar's man: Sena MP Sanjay Raut
267.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut said that it is no secret that he is NCP chief Sharad Pawar's man. "While I've been in the Sena, my relations with Pawar are close...BJP is upset because of this," he added. This comes after Enforcement Directorate said on Tuesday that it has attached properties of Raut in connection with a land scam case.

268.title: Price of lemons increases to ₹10 each in Hyd; vendors say 'nobody buying'
268.article_body: Amid rising lemon prices across the country over the past week, the price of lemons has increased to ₹10 each in Hyderabad. "Earlier, we used to purchase a whole lemon sack for ₹700, which now costs ₹3,500," a vegetable vendor said. "I bought a dozen of lemons for ₹120. Earlier, I used to purchase them for ₹20," a customer said.

269.title: India reports 1,109 new COVID-19 cases, active cases in country at 11,492
269.article_body: India has reported 1,109 new COVID-19 cases and 43 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. Active COVID-19 cases in India stand at 11,492, while the death toll has risen to 5,21,573. The country saw 1,213 recoveries in the last 24 hours, the ministry said.

270.title: PayPal Co-founder calls Warren Buffett a 'sociopathic grandpa' & Bitcoin's top enemy
270.article_body: At a Bitcoin conference, PayPal Co-founder Peter Thiel said Berkshire Hathaway Chairman Warren Buffett tops an "enemies list" of people who are trying to stop the cryptocurrency. He referred to billionaire Buffett as "the sociopathic grandpa from Omaha". Thiel also said Buffett, JP Morgan's Jamie Dimon and BlackRock's Larry Fink were a "gerontocracy" opposed to a "revolutionary" crypto movement.

271.title: FIR against Ludhiana residents who dumped waste at councillor’s office
271.article_body: An FIR has been registered against the residents of Ludhiana's Manjit Nagar, who dumped waste at the office of ward number 47 councillor Priya Kaira, following inaction over clogged sewer lines. They have been booked for rioting, theft, and trespass after Kaira's personal assistant filed a complaint against them, claiming they created a ruckus and damaged furniture at the office.

272.title: A cricketer hung me from 15th floor balcony after getting drunk in 2013: Chahal
272.article_body: Recalling an incident from IPL 2013 when he used to represent MI, RR leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal revealed that during a get-together in Bengaluru, a cricketer took him outside and hung him from the balcony after getting drunk. "I was on the 15th floor. Many people came and handled it. I kind of fainted. I made a narrow escape," he added.

273.title: Friend of Pak PM's wife, whose pic went viral, saw wealth jump during his tenure
273.article_body: The wealth of Pakistan PM Imran Khan's wife Bushra Bibi's friend Farah Khan, whose picture with a $90,000 bag went viral, reportedly grew from PKR231 million in 2017 to PKR971 million in 2021. During first three years of Khan's tenure, Farah bought properties in different cities and made investments worth millions. Farah reportedly fled to Dubai amid allegations of corruption.

274.title: Burglars who stole ₹2 cr from B'luru house held; police checking cash source
274.article_body: Two burglars looking to steal ₹2 lakh to pay debt, hit pay dirt when they got ₹2 crore at a house they burgled in Bengaluru. The police nabbed both the burglars and recovered ₹1.76 crore in cash and gold ornaments worth ₹12 lakh. The police have written to the tax department to get clarity on whether it was unaccounted cash.

275.title: Musk's Twitter investment is tiny, it's meaningless: Tesla shareholder
275.article_body: One of Tesla's largest shareholders Ron Baron, CEO of Baron Capital, said Tesla CEO Elon Musk's stake in Twitter and his accompanying board seat are not significant. "I think it's meaningless. It's a tiny investment...He has Tesla which is worth a trillion [and] on the way to being worth $3 or $4 trillion," Baron added.

276.title: Fraudster gifts new phone to film distributor in Mumbai, cheats him of ₹2.9 lakh
276.article_body: A Bollywood film distributor was allegedly cheated of ₹2.9 lakh by a fraudster who posed as a bank employee and offered him an international credit card. The fraudster told the victim that he is unable to send a link as the latter has an iPhone. To facilitate the fraud, he sent him a new phone and extorted money.

277.title: BMC to install tree tubs with wheels to prevent uprooting of plants
277.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has decided to install tree tubs with wheels to prevent trees from being uprooted during any construction work. Under Phase-I of the project, 500 such tubs will be placed in open spaces and footpaths in the Worli area. According to a BMC official, the initiative will help in increasing the green cover of the city.

278.title: Play frontal role in war against gangsters: Punjab CM tells senior police officers
278.article_body: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann has asked the Commissioners of Police and Senior Superintendents of Police to play a frontal role in the war against gangsters by personally conducting operations and interrogations. "You will be personally held responsible for any breach of law and order in your jurisdiction as you are accountable under the law," the CM further said.

279.title: Nigerian sentenced to 10 years in prison for smuggling heroin into Mohali
279.article_body: A 39-year-old Nigerian man was sentenced to 10 years of rigorous imprisonment for smuggling heroin into Mohali. The local court also imposed a fine of ₹1 lakh on him. Based on a tip-off that a man will be entering Mohali with heroin, police had stopped and checked him on suspicion in 2018. They'd recovered 260 grams of heroin from him.

280.title: Curfew extended in Rajasthan's Karauli till April 10 after communal clashes
280.article_body: The curfew imposed in Rajasthan's Karauli, where communal clashes broke out, has been extended till 12 am on April 10, the administration has announced. The curfew will be relaxed between 9 am and 12 pm daily for general stores, dairies, fuel stations and others to function, it added. Mobile internet services continue to remain suspended in Karauli.

281.title: Why was DC's Anrich Nortje barred from bowling after 14 deliveries vs LSG?
281.article_body: DC fast bowler Anrich Nortje was barred from bowling after delivering 14 balls against LSG in IPL 2022 on Thursday night. The 28-year-old pacer, featuring in his first IPL 2022 match, was taken off the attack after bowling two beamers. He bowled his first over-the-waist ball in the 14th over and the second beamer in the 16th over.

282.title: Forest dept gives nod to Delhi Metro to fell over 3,000 trees
282.article_body: Forest Department has given its nod to the Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) to fell or transplant 2,940 trees in the North Forest Division and 450 trees in the South Forest Division. In the North division, 1,963 are to be transplanted, and 977 trees will be felled. In the South Division, 299 will be transplanted, and 151 will be felled.

283.title: BharatPe CEO apologises for salary remark; firm says all employees got March salary
283.article_body: BharatPe CEO Suhail Sameer apologised for his remarks in which he indicted that Ashneer Grover "stole money" from the company and little is left to pay salaries. An employee had raised the matter of sacking of admin staff and non-payment of salaries, to which Ashneer and Suhail had responded. Meanwhile, BharatPe clarified that all employees were given their March salary.

284.title: Major fire reported at industrial unit with chemical storage in Pimpri Chinchwad
284.article_body: A major fire was reported at an industrial unit with a chemical storage in Pimpri Chinchwad's Moshi area on Thursday night. Large plastic drums storing industrial chemicals aggravated the fire into a major blaze, a fire official said, adding that some explosions were heard initially. The nature of the chemicals and details of the damages are yet to be ascertained.

285.title: Will continue to fight till last ball: Pak PM as he faces ouster vote
285.article_body: Pakistan PM Imran Khan said he would "continue to fight for Pakistan till the last ball" as the country's Supreme Court ordered that a no-confidence vote against him will take place on April 9. The court on Thursday set aside the National Assembly Deputy Speaker's ruling to dismiss the vote seeking to oust Khan. Pakistan's opposition hailed the court's decision.

286.title: 39-yr-old Hyderabad man beaten to death for misbehaving with woman
286.article_body: A 39-year-old man was beaten to death in Hyderabad for allegedly misbehaving with a woman. According to police, the man misbehaved with the woman near her house on Wednesday, following which her husband, along with some local residents, beat him with sticks. Subsequently, the man went to his house, but his family members found him dead that night, police added.

287.title: Cargo plane splits in two after emergency landing at Costa Rica airport
287.article_body: A DHL cargo plane slid off the runway and broke in half after it made an emergency landing at an airport in Costa Rica. DHL said the crew was unharmed and that one member was undergoing a medical review as a precaution. The fire department said the plane had detected a failure in the hydraulic system.

288.title: Mumbai Traffic Police to send drivers without helmets for counselling sessions
288.article_body: In a special drive against drivers found not wearing helmets, Mumbai Traffic Police has decided to impose fines through e-challans, suspend licence of such drivers for three months and also send them for two-hour-long counselling sessions. "In the last one month, we have fined over 75,000 bikers for driving without helmets," DCP Traffic (Headquarter and Central) Raj Tilak Roshan said.

289.title: 5-yr-old boy killed, grandfather injured as bike hits scooter in Delhi
289.article_body: A five-year-old boy was killed and his 58-year-old grandfather got injured after a bike hit their scooter in Southwest Delhi on Wednesday, police said. "The grandfather was...on his scooter with his two grandsons," Additional DCP Vikram Singh added. "We apprehended a 15-year-old boy...He said he was with his friend [on the bike]...were on their way home...they escaped afterwards," Singh stated.

290.title: B'luru Police ask temples, mosques to comply with noise pollution rules
290.article_body: Bengaluru Police have asked temples and mosques to comply with noise pollution rules and use the loudspeakers within the permissible decibel levels. Over 300 notices have been issued to establishments, including mosques, temples and churches, over the same, City Police Commissioner Kamal Pant said. Reportedly, police have also started seizing mics from places that allegedly defied the orders.

291.title: 22-yr-old woman delivers baby boy at Delhi Metro Station platform
291.article_body: A 22-year-old woman on Thursday delivered a baby boy at Anand Vihar Metro Station in Delhi, officials said. The woman was waiting for the metro when she reportedly developed labour pain. A female CISF personnel and other women passengers arranged for a sheet and helped in the delivery of the baby boy at the platform, a senior CISF officer added.

292.title: Badoni finishes chase with a six in last over as LSG beat DC to win 3 matches in a row
292.article_body: LSG's 22-year-old batter Ayush Badoni finished the run chase with a six in the last over as his team defeated DC to register their third straight win in IPL 2022. DC had put up a total of 149/3 in their 20 overs, with Prithvi Shaw scoring 61(34). Quinton De Kock top-scored for LSG with 80(52).

293.title: Liverpool's Klopp insists clash with Man City will not decide PL title
293.article_body: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp insists that this weekend's match against Premier League leaders Manchester City will not decide the title in their favour. "If we win against City, which is already difficult enough, I think no one would think, 'that's it, decided', because of the quality of the opponent," he said. Liverpool are currently one point behind Manchester City.

294.title: Maxwel Cornet scores to help Burnley beat Everton 3-2 in PL
294.article_body: Maxwel Cornet scored in the 85th minute to help Burnley beat Everton 3-2 in the Premier League. The defeat means Everton are one point above the relegation zone in 17th place on the Premier League table. Burnley are one point behind Everton. Brazilian international Richarlison scored twice from the penalty spot to give Everton a 2-1 lead at half-time.

295.title: Faf Du Plessis has earned respect in RCB change room: Glenn Maxwell
295.article_body: RCB all-rounder Glenn Maxwell said that Faf Du Plessis has earned the respect of everyone in RCB change room. "Not only does he lead by example, with his actions, but he also performs really well," he said. Maxwell added, "To have a guy of his quality and caper up the top of the order is something that’s great for RCB."

296.title: Patrick Mouratoglou to coach former world no. 1 Simona Halep full-time
296.article_body: Frenchman Patrick Mouratoglou, long-time coach of Serena Williams, on Thursday said he will coach former world number one Simona Halep full-time. "In the last eight months, I realised how much I missed coaching. It is the passion of my life, and I still feel like I have so much to give," he said. Halep is a two-time Grand Slam champion.

297.title: Video shows Kerala student, born without legs, being carried by friends
297.article_body: A video shot by a wedding photographer shows a student in Kerala's Kollam district being carried by his friends inside the college campus as he was born without legs. The student, Alif Mohammed, is pursuing BCom. The photographer Jagath Thulaseedharan said, "For everyone inside the college, this is a common sight as Alif is always carried around by...his friends."

298.title: We still have plenty to learn: Mercedes boss Wolff ahead of Aus GP
298.article_body: Team boss Toto Wolff said Mercedes still has plenty to learn ahead of the Australian Grand Prix this weekend. "There won't be a magic fix for the next race weekend, but we're pushing to steadily bring gains over the upcoming races, to hopefully move us closer to the front of the pack," he said referring to Ferrari and Red Bull.

299.title: Digital Rupee won't eliminate cryptos in India: CEA Nageswaran
299.article_body: Chief Economic Advisor (CEA) V Anantha Nageswaran said the introduction of a Central Bank Digital Currency, or Digital Rupee, won't lead to the elimination of cryptos and stablecoins as they satisfy different objectives. "Objective for cryptos to emerge is...tax evasion, money laundering and speculation...Therefore, they have to be tackled separately with other regulatory instruments," he said.

300.title: Want to seek EU membership separately from North Macedonia: Albania
300.article_body: Albania will approach European Union (EU) to enquire if it can pursue its membership bid separately from North Macedonia, Albanian PM Edi Rama said on Thursday. North Macedonia, which faces a veto by Bulgaria amid disputes between them, had been grouped with Albania by EU in their accession bid. "Albania cannot wait...until two neighbours resolve their quarrel," Rama added.

301.title: Why did India abstain from UNGA vote to suspend Russia from UNHRC?
301.article_body: India abstained from UNGA vote to suspend Russia from UNHRC following the killings in Ukraine. In its explanation, India said, "If India has chosen any side, it is the side of peace and it is for an immediate end to violence." India added, "Recent reports of civilian killings in Bucha are deeply disturbing...We support the call for an independent investigation."

302.title: Whistleblower alleges wrongdoing at Invesco Mutual Fund: Reports
302.article_body: A whistleblower has filed complaints with SEBI and US SEC about alleged mismanagement by Invesco Mutual Fund's fixed income team, Moneycontrol reported. Invesco is accused of having the same person holding the positions of Chief Investment Officer and Advisor to its offshore portfolio management services. The fixed income team is accused of executing trades on behalf of Invesco's offshore funds.

303.title: Pic of dresses draped on crosses near Canada site where kids were found buried wins award
303.article_body: An image of dresses draped on crosses near Kamloops in Canada, where remains of 215 children were found last year, won the 2022 World Press Photo of the Year award. The image was captured by Amber Bracken, who's the fifth female World Press Photo of the Year winner. It commemorates the children who died at the Kamloops Indian Residential School.

304.title: South films have been made in Hindi & vice versa for last 70-80 yrs: Abhishek
304.article_body: Actor Abhishek Bachchan has said that he has worked in remakes of South Indian films in the past. "South films have been made in Hindi and Hindi films have been made in the South for the last 70 to 80 years," he added. Abhishek's upcoming film will be a remake of the Tamil film 'Oththa Seruppu Size 7'.

305.title: Which are the most expensive overs in IPL history?
305.article_body: RCB all-rounder Harshal Patel and ex-KTK pacer Prasanth Parameswaran hold the record for bowling the joint-most expensive over in IPL history, conceding 37 runs each. Harshal conceded 37 runs against CSK in IPL 2021, while Parameswaran conceded 37 runs against RCB in IPL 2011. They are followed by MI all-rounder Daniel Sams, who conceded 35 runs against KKR on Wednesday.

306.title: Ukrainian PM thanks UN for humanitarian aid, asks for more support
306.article_body: After meeting UN aid chief Martin Griffiths on Thursday, Ukrainian PM Denys Shmyhal took to Twitter and thanked the UN for the humanitarian aid it received since Russia's invasion. PM Shmyhal further "stressed the need to increase support and unite efforts to provide targeted financial assistance to Ukrainians suffering from Russian aggression". The Ukraine-Russia war entered its 43rd day today.

307.title: Belarus must be involved in negotiations over Ukraine crisis: Lukashenko
307.article_body: Belarus President Alexander Lukashenko said on Thursday that his country must be involved in negotiations to resolve the conflict in Ukraine, adding that Belarus was "dragged' into it by the West. Lukashenko added that he expects to hold talks with his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin soon. Notably, several Western countries have included Belarus in sanctions against Russia over the conflict.

308.title: 2 men die after entering manhole to find gold particles in Gujarat
308.article_body: Two men who had entered a 10-feet-deep manhole to find gold particles in Gujarat's Surat died of asphyxiation on Thursday.The manhole was in an area where several small jewellery manufacturing units are located. A local resident said, "Since there are several jewellery manufacturing units in this area, gold particles get washed into the sewer."

309.title: Which nations supported Russia in resolution seeking its suspension from UNHRC?
309.article_body: As many as 24 nations voted against the draft resolution to suspend Russia from UN Human Rights Council over Ukraine war. While UNGA passed the resolution with 93 countries in its favour, the nations that voted against included China, Belarus, Burundi, Algeria, Eritrea, Congo, Syria, Kazakhstan and Iran among others. Meanwhile, over 50 nations, including India, abstained from voting.

310.title: India & US to hold 2+2 dialogue in Washington on April 11
310.article_body: The MEA on Thursday informed that India and US will hold 2+2 dialogue on April 11 in Washington. Defence Minister Rajnath Singh and External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar will hold talks with US Defence Secretary Lloyd Austin and Secretary of State Anthony Blinken. "The...dialogue will...provide an opportunity to exchange views about important regional and global developments," MEA said.

311.title: Was no chance of getting wedding licence at that hour: Kourtney
311.article_body: Kourtney Kardashian, speaking about her marriage with Travis Barker not being legal, has said that they were unable to get the licence at that hour. "It was 2 am and they were like 'it opens at 8 o'clock'," she added. Kourtney and Travis got married at a chapel in Las Vegas hours after the Grammys 2022 ceremony.

312.title: UNGA suspends Russia from UNHRC; India abstains from voting
312.article_body: The UN General Assembly (UNGA) on Thursday suspended Russia from the United Nations Human Rights Council (UNHRC). India abstained from the UN General Assembly vote. As many as 93 countries voted in the favour of the draft resolution, 24 countries voted against it and 58 countries abstained.

313.title: Pakistan PM Imran Khan loses court case, faces no-trust vote on Saturday
313.article_body: Pakistan Supreme Court has termed National Assembly Deputy Speaker's decision to dismiss the no-confidence motion against PM Imran Khan as "unconstitutional". The Supreme Court has restored the National Assembly and ordered Speaker to call for session on April 9 to organise no-confidence vote. On Sunday, the no-trust motion against Khan's government was dismissed by Deputy Speaker Qasim Suri.

314.title: Enjoyed myself while gaining 15 kgs for 'Dasvi': Nimrat Kaur
314.article_body: Actress Nimrat Kaur, in an episode of 'The Kapil Sharma Show', revealed that she gained 15 kgs for her film 'Dasvi'. "I had six months in hand so I put on weight at my own pace. I ate lots and enjoyed myself," she further said. The actress added director Tushar Jalota wanted her to look different from her previous characters.

315.title: Armenia & Azerbaijan agree to peace talks over Nagorno-Karabakh
315.article_body: Armenia and Azerbaijan have agreed to peace talks over disputed territory of Nagorno-Karabakh, following a meeting between the countries' leaders on Wednesday. The countries will set up bilateral border commission by April end, according to a statement by Armenian PM Nikol Pashinyan. The move comes amid reports of recent clashes in region, two years after large-scale conflict broke out there.

316.title: No comments: India on political crisis in Imran Khan-led Pakistan govt
316.article_body: On being asked about political turmoil in Pakistan arising after Imran Khan's decision to dissolve country's National Assembly, India's External Affairs Ministry spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said, "I have no comments." "We are watching developments but don't comment on such internal matters," he added. Pakistan's Deputy Speaker had rejected the no-confidence vote against Imran Khan.

317.title: Can do Telugu film & get seen around world: Mahesh on not doing Hindi films
317.article_body: Mahesh Babu has said, "I don't need to do Hindi films...can just do a Telugu film and it'll get seen all over the world." "You'd want to be in a position to do (only) a Telugu film," he added. This comes after Telugu films like 'Pushpa: The Rise' and 'RRR' collected over ₹300 crore and ₹200 crore, respectively, across India.

318.title: Former world no. 5 Tsonga to retire after French Open
318.article_body: Former world number five Jo-Wilfried Tsonga on Wednesday announced he will retire after the French Open this year. It will be the 15th time the Frenchman will play the French Open. "I've always set myself high goals to try and get what I can. For me, this will be the opportunity to do it one last time," the 36-year-old said.

319.title: Matteo Berrettini, Dominic Thiem withdraw from Monte Carlo Masters
319.article_body: World number six Matteo Berrettini and former US Open champion Dominic Thiem have pulled out of the ATP Masters 1000 tournament in Monte Carlo. Thiem will miss the upcoming event as he continues his recovery after having tested positive for COVID-19 last week. Berrettini meanwhile misses out due to a minor operation he had on his playing hand last week.

320.title: India, Australia name officers' exchange programme after CDS Rawat
320.article_body: Indian and Australian governments have announced an Australia-India Young Defence Officers' Exchange Programme in memory of late CDS General Bipin Rawat, who was killed in a helicopter crash in December. The programme will be named after General Rawat, Australia's High Commissioner to India Barry O'Farrell said. General Rawat took over as CDS after serving as Army chief for three years.

321.title: Jr NTR says 'SS Rajamouli should make RRR 2', director replies
321.article_body: Actor Jr NTR has said that director SS Rajamouli should make a sequel to their recently released film 'RRR'. "There needs to be a conclusion to this also," Jr NTR stated. Ram Charan added, "We all will be delighted again if Rajamouli sir thinks of RRR 2." To this, Rajamouli replied, "For me, it would be a great pleasure."

322.title: BJP's Kirron Kher meets SP's Jaya Bachchan in Parliament, shares pic
322.article_body: BJP MP from Chandigarh Kirron Kher on Thursday met Rajya Sabha MP from Samajwadi Party Jaya Bachchan in the Parliament. Sharing the picture on social media, Kher wrote, "Wonderful to meet Jaya after so long in Parliament." The Budget Session of the Parliament ended today, a day ahead of the schedule. It had started on January 31.

323.title: Austria expels 4 Russian diplomats for breach of norms
323.article_body: Austria on Thursday announced expulsion of four Russian diplomats for engaging in activities incompatible with their diplomatic status. Three envoys working at Russian Embassy in Vienna and one staffer working at Russian Consulate General in Salzburg have been asked to leave Austria by April 12. Austria joins France and Italy, among other European countries, which recently expelled Russian envoys.

324.title: 2 US personnel injured in an apparent rocket attack in Syria: Officials
324.article_body: Two US personnel were injured after an apparent rocket struck the US Air Force base overnight in Syria, officials said on Thursday. According to a report, the US-led forces also returned fire after the rockets were launched from an area where Iran-backed militias have a presence. However, no one has claimed responsibility for the attack so far.

325.title: When I put on weight, people said I am pregnant: Nargis Fakhri
325.article_body: Speaking about facing body shaming, Nargis Fakhri said, "When I first came to India, I was too skinny, so everyone was like 'You need to put on weight'." "Later I gained about 50 pounds, so they posted I was pregnant, which I thought was not funny, but also very funny. I think...my feelings got hurt," she added.

326.title: Tharoor clarifies after pic with Supriya Sule goes viral, says 'she was speaking softly'
326.article_body: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor has issued a clarification after a picture of him chatting with Supriya Sule during Farooq Abdullah's speech in Parliament went viral. "She was asking me a policy question because she was about to speak next. She was speaking softly so as not to disturb Farooq Sahib, so I leaned over to hear her," he tweeted.

327.title: 429 interns worked with MEA in last 5 years: S Jaishankar
327.article_body: As many as 429 interns have worked in the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) over the last five years, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar told the Rajya Sabha on Thursday. He added, "The MEA has been engaging interns for a decade, reflecting an intent to expand the foreign policy discourse in the country and tap into talent beyond the government."

328.title: No pressure on India over trade with Russia: MEA
328.article_body: The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA), when asked about western pressure over trade with Russia, said, "Don't think there's any such pressure. Talks of sanctions going on but it's not on the entire trade." The MEA added, "Our focus is to maintain and stabilise our established economic relations with Russia."

329.title: Opposition front not 'enough' to take on BJP: Sisodia
329.article_body: Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia on Thursday said that the formation of an Opposition front "would not be enough to take on the BJP". People have realised BJP's methods of winning elections, which they do by diverting attention from the main issues but do nothing for the masses after forming the government, he said.

330.title: Ayodhya Airport must be ready along with Ram Temple: Yogi to officials
330.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on Thursday told officials that the Maryada Purushottam Shri Ram International Airport in Ayodhya should be functional "by the time Ram Lalla moves to his new temple next year". He said air connectivity will help connect history with the present time and make Ayodhya the "most beautiful city in the world".

331.title: Onus on Pakistan to create terror-free environment for trade: Govt
331.article_body: The Centre on Thursday said India is committed to addressing issues with Pakistan and asserted that the onus of maintaining a terror and hostility-free environment for such an engagement is on Pakistan. Minister of State for External Affairs V Muraleedharan said, "India desires normal neighbourly relations." Pakistan suspended trade with India in August 2019, Muraleedharan added.

332.title: Why did we elect govt?: SC on plea to deport illegal immigrants
332.article_body: While hearing a plea filed by BJP leader and advocate Ashwini Upadhyay seeking directions for government to identify and detain all illegal immigrants within a year, CJI NV Ramana on Thursday expressed concern over SC being burdened by politically sensitive matters. "If we have to take up all your PILs, then why did we elect the government," he asked.

333.title: Number of global COVID-19 cases, deaths fell last week: WHO
333.article_body: In its weekly report, the World Health Organization (WHO) said global COVID-19 cases and deaths fell during the week of March 28 through April 3. Over nine million cases were reported across the six WHO regions last week, a 16% decrease compared to the week before. Global COVID-19 deaths also dropped by 43% with over 26,000 new deaths reported.

334.title: Voters don’t accept Babul Supriyo: CPM candidate on Bengal bypolls
334.article_body: Ahead of West Bengal Assembly bypolls, CPM's candidate from Ballygunge constituency, Saira Shah Halim, said on Wednesday that people aren't willing to vote for Trinamool Congress' (TMC) Babul Supriyo. Halim, who is also actor Naseeruddin Shah's niece, added that Supriyo is seen as "anti-minority" and isn't accepted by 'Bangali Bhadralok' (Bengali intellectuals). Supriyo resigned from BJP in 2021.

335.title: 7 heat-related deaths reported in last 2 weeks in Maharashtra
335.article_body: Maharashtra reported seven heat-related deaths and 59 heatstroke cases in the past fortnight, as per the state health department. Three deaths were reported from Jalgaon, two from Nagpur and one each from Akola and Osmanabad. With the maximum temperature settling at 44°C, Akola has been the hottest city in the country for the last three days.

336.title: Making contingency plans for possible chemical assaults in Ukraine: WHO
336.article_body: WHO's European head Hans Kluge on Thursday said that it's preparing for possible "chemical assaults" in Ukraine. Kluge said, "WHO is considering all scenarios and making contingencies for different situations that could afflict the people of Ukraine, from the continued treatment of mass casualties to chemical assaults." There are no assurances that the war will not get worse, Kluge added.

337.title: US will boycott G20 meeting if Russia is allowed to attend: Yellen
337.article_body: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said US will boycott "a number of G20 meetings" if Russian officials are allowed to attend. "President Biden has made it clear, and I certainly agree with him, that it cannot be business as usual for Russia in any of the financial institutions," Yellen said. She added Russia should be expelled from the Group of 20.

338.title: 'Goondagardi' not good for country: Kejriwal on BJP after attack
338.article_body: Criticising BJP for the attack on his house, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Thursday said that "goondagardi is not good for the country". "The protesters were people from the BJP. They came to my house and climbed the walls. My elderly parents were there. We weren't there at home," he further added.

339.title: Pic shows YouTuber, journalists stripped to their underwear at a police station in MP
339.article_body: A picture of journalists and YouTuber Kanishk Tiwari stripped to their underwear at a police station in Madhya Pradesh's Sidhi has surfaced online. Tiwari said they had gone to the station to cover the arrest of theatre artist Neeraj Kunder who was arrested for allegedly making indecent remarks about BJP MLA Kedarnath Shukla. "We were beaten, abused," Tiwari added.

340.title: Half of critics who wrote me off now ask me for work as writers: John
340.article_body: Actor John Abraham said half of the critics who wrote him off after every film during his initial acting days come to him for work as writers. "They say...'We're very sorry'," he stated. John added, "Now when they come to me for work...I try and help them and say...'You could have been good critics, you're failed writers but no problem'."

341.title: CBI makes first arrests in Birbhum violence case, nabs 4 from Mumbai
341.article_body: Days after at least nine people were killed in West Bengal's Birbhum, the CBI on Thursday arrested four people in Mumbai in connection with the case. These are the first arrests made by the CBI since it took over the case last month. Miscreants had allegedly set around 10-12 houses on fire in Birbhum's Bogtui village on March 21.

342.title: Amit Shah should be last person to talk about law & order: TMC leader
342.article_body: Trinamool Congress leader Saugata Roy criticised Union Home Minister Amit Shah for his remarks on the law and order situation in West Bengal, adding that he should be the last person to talk about it. "We are very well aware of his track record as a Minister in Gujarat and in the Union government," he said.

343.title: No election symbol allotted by EC will be deemed national symbol: Rijiju
343.article_body: Law Minister Kiren Rijiju told Rajya Sabha on Thursday that no election symbol allotted by Election Commission (EC) will be deemed as religious or national one. Rijiju's reply came after he was asked whether symbols like national bird etc, can be used by political parties. He added that government has no proposal to disallow use of national symbols by parties.

344.title: It's revolting: Presenter who received 31 videos of penis from a man on Instagram
344.article_body: A man sent 31 videos of his penis to Britain's 36-year-old TV presenter Rachel Riley through Instagram direct messages (DMs), Center for Countering Digital Hate (CCDH) researchers found. Riley, actress Amber Heard and other celebrities gave their social media accounts to non-profit CCDH for monitoring DMs. "It makes me not want to go into my DMs because...it's revolting," Riley said.

345.title: BankBazaar plans IPO in 2023; seeks to hire 1,500 employees
345.article_body: Online financial services marketplace BankBazaar plans to list an IPO in 2023, the company said on Thursday. After reporting revenue growth in FY22, the Sequoia India and Amazon-backed firm also plans to recruit over 1,500 employees across departments this year aiming to expand its product offerings. BankBazaar reported annualised revenue run rate of ₹156 crore, the company added.

346.title: Maharashtra will continue to stand tall before central agencies: Raut
346.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut on Thursday said Maharashtra will continue to stand tall before central agencies like the Enforcement Directorate and Narcotics Control Bureau. "Those who've announced a war against us and Maharashtra, I want to tell them that we're ready...A time will come when you will have to bow down on your knees before us," Raut added.

347.title: LSG, DC announce their playing XIs, DC make 3 changes as Warner returns
347.article_body: LSG captain KL Rahul won the toss and elected to bowl first against DC in their IPL 2022 encounter on Thursday. LSG have made one change to their playing XI, with Krishnappa Gowtham replacing Manish Pandey. DC have made three changes, with David Warner, Sarfaraz Khan and Anrich Nortje replacing Tim Seifert, Mandeep Singh and Khaleel Ahmed, respectively.

348.title: Was offered Heropanti 2 while shooting another film in UK: Nawazuddin
348.article_body: Nawazuddin Siddiqui said he was offered 'Heropanti 2' while he was filming for another movie in London. "They narrated the character to me while we were travelling to a...location...later we took...narration to the hotel," he added. Nawazuddin stated he was impressed when writer Rajat Arora and director Ahmed Khan narrated the character with "a lot of zeal and enthusiasm".

349.title: Over 100 weapons banned for import to boost self-reliance: Rajnath Singh
349.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Thursday released the third list of over 101 military systems and weapons that will come under an import ban and be developed indigenously to boost self-reliance. "Our two important objectives are self-reliance in the defence sector and promoting exports of military equipment," Singh said. He added that self-reliance doesn't mean isolation from the world.

350.title: 'Dasvi' review says 'Yami no longer the dead girlfriend in Hindi films', actress reacts
350.article_body: Yami Gautam reacted to a review of her performance in 'Dasvi', which read, "Yami...is no longer...the dead girlfriend in Hindi films, but the...combative smile is starting to get repetitive."
