"I usually take constructive criticism in my stride. But when a...platform keeps trying to pull you down, I felt it necessary to speak up," she said while calling it "extremely disrespectful".

351.title: Actor Sreenivasan on ventilator after undergoing bypass surgery
351.article_body: Malayalam actor and filmmaker Sreenivasan has undergone bypass surgery after the 66-year-old complained of severe chest pain. "Sreenivasan is responding well to Treatments and Medications," a health bulletin from the hospital read. According to the reports, the veteran actor has been put on a ventilator after the surgery. The actor was admitted to the hospital on March 30.

352.title: 30-yr-old abused, beaten by 3 for sporting a moustache in MP
352.article_body: A 30-year-old man was allegedly abused and beaten by three men for sporting a moustache in Madhya Pradesh's Indore, police said on Wednesday. The accused, Bunty Godha, his brother, Naveen Godha and another accomplice, were agitated over the victim's moustache, abused him and one of the accused beat him with a stick, a policeman said, quoting the complaint.

353.title: Exploring all options to procure affordable crude oil: Govt
353.article_body: Centre is exploring all viable options to procure crude oil at affordable rates, the Finance Ministry said. Rise in imports in March because of an increase in oil prices "doesn't portend well for the economy in the year ahead", the Ministry added. If fuel was available at a discount, India would buy it, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman had said earlier.

354.title: German Parliament to vote on COVID-19 vaccine mandate for elderly
354.article_body: The German Parliament known as Bundestag will vote on a series of proposals, including a COVID-19 vaccine mandate for those over 60, that is seen as likely to be approved. A simple majority is required for a proposal to pass. A recent opinion poll showed that about 60% of Germans are in favour of a COVID-19 vaccine mandate.

355.title: Person with suspected XE COVID-19 variant in Mumbai has recovered: Aaditya
355.article_body: Maharashtra minister Aaditya Thackeray tweeted on Thursday that the person suspected to be infected with the XE coronavirus variant in Mumbai has recovered. The high-risk contacts of the person have tested negative, he added. "The samples have been sent to NIBMG, to reconfirm the type of strain. We are constantly working to ensure that we are all safe," he added.

356.title: Sonu Sood swaps his business class seat with economy class seat to help elderly man
356.article_body: Actor Sonu Sood, who was returning from South Africa, offered his business class seat to an elderly man. He swapped his business class seat for an economy class seat. When the same was revealed in a tweet, Sonu wrote, "Sometimes economy seats are more comfortable than the business class seats."

357.title: Lemon prices touch ₹400 per kg in Rajasthan's Jaipur
357.article_body: Lemon prices have increased in several parts of the country amid soaring temperatures and touched ₹400 per kilogram in Rajasthan's Jaipur on Wednesday. On Tuesday, lemons were selling for ₹340 per kilogram in Jaipur. Traders at local mandis said vegetable prices soar during the summers, but an increase in the prices of fuel is triggering the price rise of produce.

358.title: Withdraw look out circular against ex-Amnesty India chief: Court tells CBI
358.article_body: A Delhi court on Thursday asked CBI to withdraw the look out circular issued against former Amnesty India chief Aakar Patel in a Foreign Contribution Regulation Act (FCRA) case. He approached the court after he was stopped from flying to the US from Bengaluru on Wednesday. CBI claimed he may flee from justice as he is an influential person.

359.title: Britain to step up supply of military equipment to Ukraine: Truss
359.article_body: Britain's Foreign Secretary Liz Truss said UK is stepping up its supply of military equipment to Ukraine. "In the face of Putin's appalling aggression in Ukraine, the G7 and NATO are stepping up our efforts on sanctions and on weapons," Truss said during a NATO meeting of foreign ministers in Brussels. Ukraine's government issued a plea for "weapons, weapons, weapons".

360.title: Maha govt launches e-learning app for Ukraine returned students
360.article_body: Maharashtra Medical Education Minister Amit Deshmukh on Thursday launched an e-learning solution for medical students who have returned from the war-torn country of Ukraine. He also launched a mobile information app of the Maharashtra University of Health Sciences (MUHS), Nashik. "Steps are being taken by the state to introduce a medical college, hospital and research centre," said Deshmukh.

361.title: Fans abused me, Ganguly said 'They'll kill you': Akhtar on dismissing Sachin in Mumbai
361.article_body: Recalling dismissing Sachin Tendulkar in an IPL match in Mumbai, ex-Pakistan and KKR pacer Shoaib Akhtar said, "I dismissed him in first over...that was a huge mistake." Akhtar added, "I got a lot of abuses when I was at fine leg. Sourav Ganguly said, 'Come to mid-wicket...these people will kill you. Who told you to dismiss Sachin...that too in Mumbai?'"

362.title: Russia's ruble surges to the level it was before Putin invaded Ukraine
362.article_body: Russia's ruble has surged back to the levels where it was before President Vladimir Putin invaded Ukraine, trading at 74.2625 per dollar in early Moscow trade on Thursday. This comes as foreign countries continue to buy Russian oil and natural gas, supporting the ruble. International sanctions had earlier sunk the ruble to a record low of 121.5 rubles per dollar.

363.title: Australia to impose further sanctions on 67 Russians over Ukraine
363.article_body: Australia's Foreign Minister Marise Payne on Thursday said the country will impose financial sanctions and travel bans on 67 Russian individuals over Ukraine invasion. Payne said the new sanctions follow "the emergence of evidence of war crimes committed by Russia in Bucha and other towns around Kyiv." Russian Deputy PM Dmitry Grigorenko is among those individuals newly sanctioned by Australia.

364.title: Want Big B to be my jail inmate, Karan Johar will be wonderful CM: Nimrat
364.article_body: When asked which Bollywood actor she would like to take along with her inside a lock-up for 10 days, Nimrat Kaur replied Amitabh Bachchan. "I have always wanted to work with him...it's a big wish," she added. She further said filmmaker Karan Johar will make a "wonderful" Chief Minister. "Karan will be so lovely, so warm, and entertaining," Nimrat stated.

365.title: Principal helps students cheat in Class 10 board exam in Haryana, held
365.article_body: The principal of a government school, a teacher and two staff members have been arrested for allegedly helping students cheat in the Class 10 board exam for Hindi subject, police said. Computers, two printer-cum-photostat machines and some slips to help the students have been seized from the school. The matter was reported after a complaint by the flying squad.

366.title: First 10,000 e-cycle buyers in Delhi to get ₹5,500 subsidy: Gahlot
366.article_body: Delhi Transport Minister Kailash Gahlot on Thursday said the Delhi government will provide a subsidy of ₹5,500 each for the first 10,000 buyers of e-cycles. An additional subsidy of ₹2,000 will be provided to the first 1,000 buyers. Subsidy will also be given on purchase of heavy duty cargo e-cycles and e-carts, he said.

367.title: UN to vote on Russia's suspension from Human Rights Council
367.article_body: The UN General Assembly on Thursday will vote to suspend Russia from the UN Human Rights Council. The US pushed for a vote following reports of "gross and systematic violations and abuses of human rights" by Russian troops in Ukraine. A two-thirds majority of the 193-member General Assembly is required to suspend a nation from the 47-member council.

368.title: UAE's Abu Dhabi to ban single-use plastic bags from June
368.article_body: Authorities in Abu Dhabi, the capital city of United Arab Emirates (UAE), announced on Wednesday that single-use plastic bags will be banned from June. The Environment Agency-Abu Dhabi (EAD) said that it will phase out use of products like styrofoam cups and food containers by 2024. Notably, Dubai will begin charging a fee on use of plastic bags from July.

369.title: We will respond: Russia after US imposes sanctions on Putin's daughters
369.article_body: Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov on Thursday said that Russia will "definitely respond" to new US sanctions against Russia and President Vladimir Putin's relatives. He said, "Russia will definitely respond and will do it the way it considers necessary." This comes after the US on Wednesday announced new sanctions on Russian financial institutions and individuals, including Putin's two daughters.

370.title: Delhi Minorities Commission issues show cause notice over meat ban
370.article_body: The Delhi Minorities Commission on Thursday issued show cause notices to the Mayors and Commissioners of Delhi's three municipal corporations seeking an explanation for their decision to order meat vendors to close their shops during Navratri. "Senior authorities and the courts should step in and put a stop to such behaviour," said Delhi Minorities Commission Chairperson Zakir Khan.

371.title: Pic of Rishi, Neetu's reception card goes viral ahead of Ranbir, Alia's rumoured wedding
371.article_body: Ahead of Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt's rumoured wedding, a picture of Ranbir's parents Rishi and Neetu Kapoor's reception card has gone viral. Their reception was held on January 23, 1980, a day after they got married. Several reports have claimed that Ranbir and Alia will get married this month.

372.title: Fintech firm Bolt to buy crypto firm Wyre in $1.5 bn deal: Reports
372.article_body: Payments-focused fintech firm Bolt Financial is buying crypto-services startup Wyre Payments in a $1.5 billion deal, Wall Street Journal reported on Thursday. This would be the largest merger in the crypto sector that didn't involve a special purpose acquisition company, according to research firm Dealogic. Wyre last year connected to the Visa network after joining its Fintech Fast Track Program.

373.title: MNS' Pune chief removed after his different view on loudspeakers' removal
373.article_body: The Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) has removed Vasant More as the party's Pune chief, days after he took a different stand on party chief Raj Thackeray's directive on the removal of loudspeakers from mosques. Thackeray has now appointed Sainath Babar as the party's Pune chief. More said that he was not asked or informed to resign from the post.

374.title: Entire Andhra Pradesh cabinet resigns as CM Jagan prepares new cabinet
374.article_body: As Andhra Pradesh CM YS Jagan Mohan Reddy is preparing a new cabinet, all 24 cabinet ministers resigned on Thursday after completing their final cabinet meeting. The ministers sent their resignations to Reddy at the state secretariat. Notably, the YSRCP chief had planned to reshuffle his cabinet in December 2021, but it was postponed due to the coronavirus pandemic.

375.title: Your brother stole all money: BharatPe CEO to Ashneer's sister on unpaid salaries
375.article_body: BharatPe CEO Suhail Sameer responded, "Your brother stole all the money...Very little left to pay salaries," to a comment by Ashneer Grover's sister on LinkedIn, criticising him for not paying salaries to some employees. Sameer later apologised and removed the comment. The comments were made on a LinkedIn post by a BharatPe employee who was demanding his salary for March.

376.title: May face impairment losses of up to $5 bn due to Russia exit: Shell
376.article_body: Oil and natural gas giant Shell is writing off $4 billion to $5 billion in assets after it pulled its operations in Russia. On March 8, Shell announced that it would exit the Russian oil and natural gas sector and close all its service stations in response to the Russia-Ukraine war. "These charges are expected to be identified," Shell said.

377.title: How much tax is collected in each state for petrol?
377.article_body: Petrol prices differ from state to state depending on local taxation (VAT) and freight charges apart from excise duty charged by the Centre. Taking ₹100/litre as base price of petrol for every state, an Indian Express infographic citing government data states that tax paid in Maharashtra is ₹65.22, Delhi is ₹48.5, Uttarakhand is ₹46.07, Karnataka is ₹55.02, Telangana is ₹64.3.

378.title: Russia facing most difficult situation in 3 decades amid sanctions: PM
378.article_body: Russian PM Mikhail Mishustin on Thursday said the country is facing the most difficult situation in three decades due to unprecedented Western sanctions over Ukraine. He, however, added that the foreign attempts to isolate Russia from the global economy would fail. Notably, the United States has announced new sanctions on Russian individuals, including President Vladimir Putin's two daughters.

379.title: Everyone should comply with K'taka HC's order on loudspeakers: Kharge
379.article_body: Congress' Mallikarjun Kharge said on Thursday that all communities must abide by Karnataka High Court's (HC) order to curb use of loudspeakers in religious institutions. He, however, added that such issues shouldn't be brought up for polarisation purposes. Kharge's comment comes after Karnataka government said it wants to implement HC's order on regulating sound volume of loudspeakers in mosques.

380.title: Coca-Cola to set up 2nd plant worth ₹1,000 cr in Telangana
380.article_body: Hindustan Coca-Cola Beverages on Thursday signed a partnership with the Telangana government and announced a fresh investment of ₹1,000 crore for setting up their second factory in the state. Coca-Cola will initially invest ₹600 crore in the new facility and add another ₹400 crore over the next five years, reports said. The facility will manufacture packaged beverages, juices and more.

381.title: Video shows AIMIM corporator arguing with police over parking in Hyd
381.article_body: A video shows AIMIM corporator Syed Sohail Quadri getting into an altercation with the police over a parking issue near the Mecca Mosque. Several vehicles were parked near the mosque and police had gone there to remove the vehicles. The corporator also spoke with the Superintendent of Police on the phone over the matter.

382.title: Will begin shooting for film with Akshay Kumar in 2023: Priyadarshan
382.article_body: Filmmaker Priyadarshan has said that the shooting of his upcoming film with actor Akshay Kumar will begin in 2023. "My film with Akshay is on the scripting stage. Few things are happening, and the film got delayed because of COVID-19," he said. Speaking about the sequel to his 2004 film 'Hulchul', Priyadarshan said, "I have not decided anything."

383.title: Manipur minister meets girl, who attended school with sister in lap
383.article_body: Manipur minister Thongam Biswajit Singh on Wednesday met Meiningsinliu Pamei, the 10-year-old girl who attended school while her two-year-old sister sat in her lap. Pamei's picture had gone viral earlier. "We have decided to assist her education through a boarding school and promised her parents that I will be looking after all her expenses till she graduates," Singh tweeted.

384.title: Russia's key objective is to capture all of Ukraine: Minister
384.article_body: Amid the ongoing Ukraine-Russia war, Ukrainian Deputy Defence Minister Hanna Malyar has said that Russia's long-term objective is to seize all of Ukraine. Malyar said, "The key objective of the Russian Federation was and is the capture of the entire territory of Ukraine." However, Russia said its "special military operation" in Ukraine is aimed at "demilitarising" and "denazifying" the country.

385.title: Muslim govt employees can leave offices 1 hr early during Ramzan in Andhra
385.article_body: The Andhra Pradesh government on Thursday said government employees, teachers, contractual employees and outsourcing officers, who follow Islam, can leave offices one hour early on all working days during Ramzan. They can leave early till May 2, the order signed by Chief Secretary Dr Sameer Sharma read. Earlier, Delhi Jal Board passed a similar order but withdrew it later.

386.title: SP MLA's petrol pump razed with bulldozers in UP, video surfaces
386.article_body: A petrol pump owned by SP MLA Shazil Islam Ansari was razed with bulldozers by district officials after claiming that it was built without necessary permission in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly. A video of the incident has surfaced online. This comes days after a purported video clip showed Ansari making provocative remarks against CM Yogi Adityanath.

387.title: Pant is very exciting as he takes the game on in any situation: Watson
387.article_body: DC assistant coach Shane Watson said captain Rishabh Pant is very exciting to watch as he takes the game on in any situation. "Pant reads the game really well which you can see with the way he has developed his own game, and the progress that he has made. He will always be a good leader," stated Ajit Agarkar.

388.title: Women oppressed in showbiz for a long time, we are like beaten dogs: Eiza
388.article_body: Hollywood actress Eiza Gonzalez Reyna said women have been oppressed in the showbiz industry for a long time, adding that they are similar to beaten dogs. "I don't have to just oblige to the rules that the industry has in a parameter for me," stated Eiza. "I can be a multi-hyphenated personality and do many things," said Eiza.

389.title: Musk denies selling Twitter shares, says 'initial number was incorrect'
389.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk has refuted reports claiming he had reduced his stake in Twitter from 9.2% to 9.1%. "No sale took place. Initial share number filed was incorrect," he said in response to a claim that he had sold 371,900 Twitter shares. A filing on Tuesday showed that the Tesla CEO had taken a 9.1% stake in Twitter.

390.title: Development revenue runs out: Pawar on AAP's free electricity scheme
390.article_body: While speaking on the Aam Aadmi Party-led Delhi government's free electricity and water scheme, Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar said that people like freebies but political parties must think about long-term development. Pawar further said that development revenue runs out in providing water and electricity for free to people. He also urged the Centre to reduce tax on fuel.

391.title: SpaceX, US govt's USAID deliver 5,000 Starlink teminals to Ukraine
391.article_body: The United States Agency for International Development (USAID) said it has provided 5,000 Starlink satellite internet terminals to Ukraine, in partnership with SpaceX. The agency purchased 1,333 terminals, while SpaceX donated 3,667 terminals and the internet service itself. Ukraine's Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov had asked for SpaceX's help with internet services after Russia's invasion.

392.title: Man wanted in 11 cases arrested after gunfight in UP’s Bulandshahr
392.article_body: A man, wanted in 11 cases, was arrested on Wednesday following a gunfight with police in UP's Bulandshahr, officials said. The accused sustained bullet injury in retaliatory firing by the police and was taken to hospital. His accomplice was also arrested a few hours later, police added. They were allegedly apprehended while trying to rob a businessman.

393.title: Businessman sets 25-yr-old son on fire in broad daylight in B'luru; act caught on CCTV
393.article_body: A businessman in Bengaluru killed his 25-year-old son by setting him on fire in broad daylight after pouring thinner on him. A CCTV footage of the incident shows the victim running on a street in pain after being set ablaze. The accused took the step reported after his son failed to give account details of ₹1.5 crore.

394.title: You've to do remake with respect for original film: Shahid on Jersey
394.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor, speaking about remaking 'Jersey' in Bollywood, said, "You have to make it original...you have to make it yours and you have to do it with a lot of respect for the original film." However, he added keeping all the important things from the original film is difficult. Shahid's film is a remake of the Telugu film 'Jersey'.

395.title: Pic shows leg of dinosaur 'killed on same day' a giant asteroid hit Earth
395.article_body: A preserved leg of a dinosaur thought to have been killed on the day a giant asteroid slammed into Earth, wiping them out, has been found. The limb, complete with skin, was found at the Tanis fossil site in North Dakota, reported BBC. It is widely accepted that a roughly 12 km-wide asteroid hit our planet 66 million years ago.

396.title: Get on the right side of history: Ukraine to Hungary over Russia
396.article_body: Ukraine has accused Hungary of destroying the unity of the European Union over Russia's invasion after Budapest said it was prepared to pay in rubles for Russian gas. "If Hungary...wants to help end...war...[it should] not create additional sources of funding for Russia's military machine. It's never too late to get on the right side of history," Ukraine Foreign Ministry said.

397.title: LSG are looking like the team to beat in IPL 2022: Morne Morkel
397.article_body: Ex-SA pacer Morne Morkel has said LSG are looking like the team to beat in the ongoing IPL season. "It was a fantastic effort from LSG to defend their 170-run target against SRH...they've three fantastic bowlers to bowl at the back end...[Avesh Khan, Andrew Tye and Jason Holder]," stated Morkel. LSG will play their fourth game against DC on Thursday.

398.title: 2,200 Indian Sikh pilgrims given visas to attend Baisakhi: Pakistan
398.article_body: Pakistan has issued visas to 2,200 Sikh pilgrims from India for attending Baisakhi celebrations from April 12 to 21, said the country's embassy. "During their visit to Pakistan, the pilgrims would…go to Panja Sahib, Nankana Sahib and Kartarpur Sahib," it added. It further said that visas have been issued to Sikh pilgrims from other countries as well.

399.title: One kid dies, another suffers injuries after stray dogs attack them in UP
399.article_body: While one kid died, another suffered serious injuries after stray dogs attacked two minors, playing outside their house near the Thakurganj police station area of Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow on Wednesday night. "The matter is being investigated and such stray dogs are being identified from the places wherever they are," the Municipal Commissioner said, addressing the issue of catching stray dogs.

400.title: India at par with world in disaster management: Amit Shah
400.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Thursday said India has increased its stature in disaster management. Now its capacity is at par with many other countries in the world and ahead of them on various occasions, Shah added. "We have travelled a long way in disaster management...Now we are able to get information much before any disaster," Shah stated.
